auguro: <entryFree id="n4492" type="main" key="augu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augūro</orth>, v. auguror <sense id="n4492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auguror: <entryFree id="n4493" type="main" key="augu^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augŭror</orth>, ātus. <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (class. for the ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <sense id="n4493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> augnro, āre, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>) [augur]. </sense><sense id="n4493.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To perform the services</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fill the office of an augur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take auguries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observs and interpret omens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to augur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi> (hence with the <hi rend="ital">acc. of</hi> that which is prophesied): <cit><quote lang="la">Calchas ex passerum numero belli Trojani annos auguratus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis quasdam rerum augurandarum causa esse natas putamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N D. 2, 64, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (scypho) augurari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurandi scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 44, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 19, 26</bibl>.—Transf from the sphere of religion, </sense><sense id="n4493.2" n="II" level="1"> Ingen, <hi rend="ital">to predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretell;</hi> or of the internal sense (cf. augurium, II. A.), <hi rend="ital">to surmise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theramenes Critiae, cui venenum praebiberat, mortem est auguratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex nomine istins, quid in provinciā facturus esset, perridicule homines augurabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Persis augurantur et divinant Magi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 90</bibl></cit>: Recte auguraris de me nihil a me abesse longius crudelitate, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A: <cit><quote lang="la">futurae pugnae fortunam ipso cantu augurantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego opinione auguror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum auguror coniectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21</bibl></cit>. 95; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mente aliquid, Curt 10, 5, 13: Hac ego contentus auguror esse deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant, qui Vespasianum et arma Orientis augurarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedones iter jaciendo operi monstrāsse eam (beiuam) augurabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.!*? The <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> subordinate form <orth extent="full" lang="la">auguro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (by Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg A. 7, 273</bibl>, erroneously distinguished from this in signif.). </sense><sense id="n4493.3" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) Sacerdotes salutem populi auguranto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: oculis investigans astute augura, <hi rend="ital">look carefully around you like an augur</hi>, Plant. Cist. 4, 2, 26.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: res, locus auguratur, <hi rend="ital">is consecrated by auguries</hi>: certaeque res augurantur, Lucius Caesar ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Rostris, in illo augurato templo ac loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 5</bibl>: augurato (<hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">after taking auguries</hi> (cf. auspicato under auspicor <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sicut Romulus augurato in urbe condenda regnum adeptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub. Roth.—</sense><sense id="n4493.4" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) Hoc conjecturā auguro, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 8</bibl> (Trag. v. 327 Vahl.); so Pac. ap. Non. l. l.; Att. ib.; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. Rep. Fragm. ib. (p. 431 Moser): praesentit animus et augurat quodam modo, quae futura sit suavitas, id. Ep. ad Caiv. ib. (IV. 2, p. 467 Orell.): si quid veri mens augurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non prima repellat Monstra deum longosque sibi mon auguret annos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:356" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 356</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
augusta: <entryFree id="n4494" type="main" key="Augusta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augusta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>dat.</case> Augustal) [augustus]. <sense id="n4494.0" n="I" level="1"> Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">a litle of the mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sister of the emperor;</hi> like our <hi rend="ital">Imperial Majesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Imperial Highness</hi>, Tac A. 1, 8; 15, 23; 4, 16; 12, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:H. 2:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 89</bibl>, Snet. Calig. 10; 15; 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Claud. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Ner. 35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Dom. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84, 6</bibl> Schwarz.—</sense><sense id="n4494.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several towns</hi>, among which the most distinguished were, </sense><sense id="n4494.2" n="A" level="2"> Augusta Taurinorum, now <hi rend="ital">Turin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 66</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 191.—</sense><sense id="n4494.3" n="B" level="2"> Augusta Praetoria, in Upper <cb n="AUGU" /> Italy, now (by a corruption of the word Augusta) <hi rend="ital">Aosta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 186 sq.—</sense><sense id="n4494.4" n="C" level="2"> In Treveris Augusta, now <hi rend="ital">Treves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl> (colonia Treverorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n4494.5" n="D" level="2"> Augusta Vindelicorum, now <hi rend="ital">Augsburg</hi>, Itin. Anton.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 41</bibl>, n. 4 Rupert.— </sense><sense id="n4494.6" n="E" level="2"> Augusta Emerida <hi rend="ital">on the Anas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lusitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Merida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 117</bibl>; cf. Mann. Hispan. p. 331.</sense></entryFree>
augustalicius: <entryFree id="n4495" type="gloss" key="Augusta_li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustālĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one clothed with the dignity of priest of Augustus</hi> (v. Augustalis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 6, 163</bibl>.—From</sense></entryFree>
augustalis: <entryFree id="n4496" type="main" key="Augusta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the emperor Augusius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Augustan</hi>: ludi (or AVGVSTALIA in the Calendar in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 411</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">celebrated on the 12th of October</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in commemoration of the day on which Augustus returned to Rome</hi>, Tao. A. 1, 15 and 54: <cit><quote lang="la">sodales,</quote> <trans><tr>a college of twenty-five priests instituted in honor of Augustus</tr>, <tr>after his death</tr>, <tr>by Tiberius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustaies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 610</bibl>. In the municipal cities and colonies there were such colleges of priests of Augustus, composed of six men, called Seviri Augustales, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 197 sq.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">The prefect of Egypt was called</hi> Praefectus Augustalis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">vir spectabilis Augustalis, Cod. 10, 31, 57 and 59.— Augustales milites,</quote> <trans><tr>those added by Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
augustalitas: <entryFree id="n4497" type="main" key="Augusta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Augustalis</etym>. <sense id="n4497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The dignity of priest of Augustus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1858</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3213</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3678</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4497.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The dignity of prefect of Egypt</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 11, 11.</sense></entryFree>
augustamnica: <entryFree id="n4498" type="main" key="Augustamni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustamnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Augustusamnis</etym>, <sense id="n4498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a designation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the time of Diocletian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the eastern part of Lower Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which were the cities Pelusium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rhinocolura</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16</bibl>; Cod. Th. 1, 14, 1.</sense></entryFree>
augustanus: <entryFree id="n4499" type="main" key="Augusta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustānus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustīānus</orth>, Suet Ner 25; Front. Col. pp. 1, 106, 139 Goes.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustānĕus</orth>, Auct. Limit. p. 265 Goes.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Augustus</etym>. <sense id="n4499.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Augustus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DOMVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2350</bibl></cit> and 2947.—</sense><sense id="n4499.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustani,</quote> <trans><tr>Roman knights appointed by Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4499.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of cities which had the title Augusta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
augustatus: <entryFree id="n4500" type="main" key="augusta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augustātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. augusto.</entryFree>
auguste: <entryFree id="n4501" type="main" key="auguste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. augustus <sense id="n4501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
augusteus: <entryFree id="n4502" type="main" key="Auguste_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Augustus</etym>, <sense id="n4502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Augustan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. p. 121" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. p. 121</bibl></cit> Goes: <cit><quote lang="la">termini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> pp. 119, 121, 122: <cit><quote lang="la">charta, also called regia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 74</bibl>): marmor, v. 2. Augustus, II.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a temple built in honor of Augustus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
augustianus: <entryFree id="n4503" type="main" key="Augusti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustĭānus</orth>, v. Augustanus.</entryFree>
augustinus: <entryFree id="n4504" type="main" key="Augusti_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Augustus</etym>, <sense id="n4504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Augustus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans><tr>the chariot of Augustus</tr>.</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cland. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4505" type="main" key="Augusti_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, as D. Aurelius Augustinus, <hi rend="ital">St. Augustine</hi>, the greatest of the Latin fathers, A. D. 354-430; cf. Tenffel. Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 434.</sense></entryFree>
augusto: <entryFree id="n4506" type="main" key="augusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. augustus</etym>, <sense id="n4506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render venerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glorify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 201</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">augustātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">made venerable</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consecrated</hi>: mensa, Jus Pap. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
augustobrigenses: <entryFree id="n4507" type="main" key="Augustobrigenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustobrigenses</orth>, <itype>tum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city Augustobriga in Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22</bibl>. 35, § 118.</sense></entryFree>
augustodunum: <entryFree id="n4508" type="main" key="Augusto^du_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustŏdūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a iown of the Ædui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Autun.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl> and 45.</sense></entryFree>
augustus: <entryFree id="n4509" type="main" key="augustus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from augeo, as angustus from ango; v. augeo</etym>, originally belonging to the language of religion, <sense id="n4509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">majestic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">august</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of honor</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; in Cic. mostly in connection with sanctus; never in Plaut., Ter., Lucr, or Hor.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: magnus, venerabilis, venerandus): sancta vocant augusta patres: augusta vocantur Templa, sacerdotum rite dicata manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:609 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 609 sq.</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">*pa/nta ga\r ta\ e)ntimo/taga kai ta i(erwtata *au)/gousta prosagoreuetai</foreign>, Dio Cass. 53, 16: <cb n="AULA" /> augurium, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 494 Vahl.): Cives ominibus faustis augustam adhibeant Faventiam, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 206, 1</bibl>, and p. 357, 15 (Trag. Rel. p. 202 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusis sancta illa et augusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctus augustusque fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber, qui augusta haec loca Cithaeronis colis, auct. inc., Trag. Rel. p. 268 Rib.: locus augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augustissimo et celeberrimo in templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 153</bibl></cit> (augurio consecrata, Serv.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas (caelestium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 270</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 145</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to other things (so most freq. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">tectum augustum, ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 170</bibl></cit>.—Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 228</bibl></cit> (augustum: abusive, nobile, quasi majestatis plenum, Serv.): ut primordia urbium augustiora faciat, Liv. praef § 5: habitus formaque viri, id 1, 7, 9; so, <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus habitusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augustissima vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augustior currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:92:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 92, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augustissimum tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 2</bibl></cit> al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">augustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">reverently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacredly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auguste sancteque consecrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit> auguste sancteque venerari, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 53</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp</hi> non quo de religione dici posset augustius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 83</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> prob. not in use</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4510" type="main" key="Augustus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1 augustus</etym>. <sense id="n4510.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Octavius Cœsar after he attained to undivided authority</hi> (acc. to Ov F 1, 590, after the year of Rome 727, Id. Jan.), and, after him, <hi rend="ital">of all the Roman emperors;</hi> equivalent to <hi rend="ital">Majesty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Imperial Majesty</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>; Flor 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, Dio Cass. 53, 16: <foreign lang="greek">e)c ou(=per kai\ *sebasto\n au)ton kai e(llhni/zonte/s pws w=sper tina\ septo\n a)po\ tou= seba/zesqai prosei=pon</foreign>), Hor C, 1, 12; 4, 5; 4, 14; 4, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1 al.</bibl>; Ov M 15, 860; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 590</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 676</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 567</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 25, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 25</bibl> et saep.; later: semper Augustus, Symm Ep. 2, 30 al.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n4510.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Augustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to Augustus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Augustan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi> caput, i. e. Augustus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 869</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> P 1, 2, 117</bibl></cit> forum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes, id M 1, 562: domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: Principis augustā Caprearum in rupe sedentis, Juv 10, 93 Jahn (where Hermann reads <hi rend="ital">angusta</hi>) pax, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Vell 2, 126: cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor (in Egypt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit> (cf <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 5, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Au gusteum): laurus, also called regia, the best species of it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:129:17:10:11:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 129, 17, 10, 11, § 60</bibl></cit>: flcus, Macr S. 2, 16.—But esp Men. sis Augustus, <hi rend="ital">the month of August</hi>, named after Augustus; earlier called Sextilis (cf <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and Julius <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), Juv 3, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">Katendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:123 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 123 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:68" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 68</bibl></cit> et saep.—Augusta aula, i. e. Domitiani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:40" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 40</bibl> historia, <hi rend="ital">the history of the Roman emperors</hi>, Vop <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 10</bibl>.—In gen., <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royal.</hi> ma. trem regis ex augusto deposuit imperio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 15, 16</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aula: <entryFree id="n4511" type="greek" key="aula1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n4511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> aulāī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 354</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl I. p 11), = <foreign lang="greek">au)lh/</foreign> </sense><sense id="n4511.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the front court of a Grecian house</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. atrium): janitor aulae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cerberus</hi>, Hor C. 3, 11, 16; also <hi rend="ital">a court for the cattle</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">au)lh</foreign>; Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 60</bibl>): vacuam pastoris in aulam, Prop 4, 12, 39; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 167</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">an inner court of a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hall</hi>, = atrium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 354</bibl> lectus genialis in aulā est, Hor Ep 1, 1, 87—</sense><sense id="n4511.2" n="II" level="1"> Transf </sense><sense id="n4511.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A palace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the castle of a noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the royal court</hi> (syn.. regia, palatium, basilica): illā se jactet in aulā Aeolus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 140</bibl> (cf. Hom. Od 10, 1 sq.) fuscae deus aulae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:11:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 11, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta Priami aula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 14, 36 al.: rarissimam rem in aulā consequi senectutem,</quote> <trans><tr>in a court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caret invidendā Sobrius aulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the cell of the queen-bee</hi>: aulas et cerea regna refingunt, Verg G. 4, 202.—</sense><sense id="n4511.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4511.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Princely power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex omniauctoritate aulae communita imperium cum dignitate obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4</bibl></cit> qui tum aulā et novo rege potiebatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">possessed the highest influence at court</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 43</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n4511.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The persons belonging to the court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <pb n="206" /> <cb n="AULU" /> <hi rend="ital">court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prona in eum aula Neronis (erat) ut similem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Claudius inter ludibria aulae erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n4512" type="main" key="aula2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aula</orth>, = olla, q. v. <sense id="n4512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aulaeum: <entryFree id="n4513" type="greek" key="aulaeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)lai/a</foreign> (Plut.), <sense id="n4513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a splendidly wrought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embroidered stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tapestry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arras</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hangings</hi>: aulaea genus vestis peregrinum, Varr. de Vita populi Rom. lib. III.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 537 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulaea dicta sunt ab aulā Attali, in quā primum inventa sunt vela ingentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n4513.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canopy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensa aulaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 54</bibl></cit>; and so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:30:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 30, 12</bibl>.—In partic., <hi rend="ital">the curtain of a theatre;</hi> which, among the ancients, contrary to modern usage, was lowered from the ceiling to the floor at the beginning of a piece or act, and at the conclusion was drawn up; cf. Smith, Dict. Antiq.; hence the expression, aulaeum tollitur, <hi rend="ital">is drawn up</hi>, at the end of a piece (act), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 111</bibl>; on the contr. mittitur, <hi rend="ital">is dropped</hi>, at the beginning, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl>. Usually such curtains were wrought with the figures of gods or men, esp. of heroes, and in <hi rend="ital">drawing up</hi> the curtain, the upper part of the figures would first become visible, then the lower parts in succession, appearing, as it were, themselves to draw up the curtain; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, utque Purpurea intexti tollant aulaea Britanni,</quote> <trans><tr>and how the Britons woven upon it lift the purple curtain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 25</bibl></cit> Voss; cf. also Ov. M. l. l. Bach.—</sense><sense id="n4513.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A covering for beds and sofas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tapestry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulaeis jam se regina superbis Aurea composuit spondā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cenae sine aulaeis et ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:15" default="NO">8, 9, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4513.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The drapery of a heavy upper garment</hi>, pictae Sarrana ferentem Ex umeris aulaea togae, <hi rend="ital">the folds of his embroidered toga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aulax: <entryFree id="n4514" type="main" key="aulax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)=lac</foreign>, <sense id="n4514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 28, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 10</bibl> (old edd., <hi rend="ital">aulix;</hi> the true form was restored by Schneider).</sense></entryFree>
aulerci: <entryFree id="n4515" type="main" key="Aulerci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulerci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)li/rkioi</foreign>, <sense id="n4515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Celtic Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 5</bibl>; acc. to Cæsar, divided into three branches. </sense><sense id="n4515.1" n="I" level="1"> Aulerci Eburovīces or Eburōnes (in Ptolem. <foreign lang="greek">*au)li/rkioi )*ebourai+koi/</foreign>), whose chief city was Mediolanum, now <hi rend="ital">Dép. de l</hi>'<hi rend="ital">Eure</hi>, in Normandy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4515.2" n="II" level="1"> Aulerci Cenomani, now <hi rend="ital">Dép. de la Sarthe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4515.3" n="III" level="1"> Aulerci Brannovīces, now <hi rend="ital">le Briennais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aulestes: <entryFree id="n4516" type="main" key="Aulestes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulestes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Tuscan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a confederate of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 290</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auletes: <entryFree id="n4517" type="main" key="Aule_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flute-player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the surname of the exiled Egyptian king Ptolemy</hi>, Cic Rab. Post. 10, 28.</sense></entryFree>
auletica: <entryFree id="n4518" type="greek" key="aule_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)lhtikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n4518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> chamaemelon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auleticus: <entryFree id="n4519" type="greek" key="aule_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)lhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for a pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aulicocia: <entryFree id="n4520" type="gloss" key="auli^co^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulĭcŏcĭa</orth>, v. olla.</entryFree>
aulicus: <entryFree id="n4521" type="greek" key="auli^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)liko/s [au)lh/]</foreign>, <sense id="n4521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a prince</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">luctatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">aulĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">courtiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4522" type="greek" key="auli^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)liko/s [au)lo/s]</foreign>, <sense id="n4522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 314</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aulis: <entryFree id="n4523" type="main" key="Aulis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulis</orth>, <itype>is or ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)li/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which the Grecian fleet set sail for Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 426</bibl>: Aulin (<case>acc.</case>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 236</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aulix: <entryFree id="n4524" type="main" key="aulix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. aulax.</entryFree>
auloedus: <entryFree id="n4525" type="greek" key="auloedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auloedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)lw(do/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sings to the flute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (quoted by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 79</bibl>); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:66" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aulon: <entryFree id="n4526" type="main" key="Aulon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n4526.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vine - bearing mountain and adjacent valley in Calabria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:125" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 125</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 553</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4526.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aulula: <entryFree id="n4527" type="hapax" key="aulu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aula = olla</etym>, <sense id="n4527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pipkin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5</bibl>, c. 20, p. 167 dub. (Hildebr., <hi rend="ital">caucula</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
aulularia: <entryFree id="n4528" type="main" key="Aulu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aulula, <hi rend="ital">dim.;</hi> v. aula = olla</etym>, <sense id="n4528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comedy of Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from the money-pot of its avaricious hero.</hi> <cb n="AURA" /></sense></entryFree>
aulus: <entryFree id="n4529" type="greek" key="aulus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aulus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)lo/s</foreign> (flute), <sense id="n4529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fluteshaped kind of scollop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 32, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4530" type="main" key="Aulus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aulus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen</hi>, usu. abbrev. to A.; e. g. A. Albinus, A. Cluentius Avitus, etc.</sense></entryFree>
aumatium: <entryFree id="n4531" type="main" key="auma_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aumātĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a private place in the theatre</hi>, Petr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 567, 20</bibl>, where some read <hi rend="ital">aumarium</hi>, and others <hi rend="ital">armarium.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aura: <entryFree id="n4532" type="greek" key="aura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n4532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> aurāï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 747</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 11; also, auras, like familias, custodias, terras, etc.; Servius gives this in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 801</bibl>; still all the MSS. give aurae, and so Rib.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)/ra [*a*w, au)/w</foreign>, to blow]. </sense><sense id="n4532.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The air</hi>, as in gentle motion, <hi rend="ital">a gentle breeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breath of air</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">aër, ventus, spiritus): agitatus aër auram facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: semper aër spiritu aliquo movetur; <cit><quote lang="la">frequentius tamen auras quam ventos habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus, qui non aura, non procella, sed venti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et me... nunc omnes terrent aurae,</quote> <trans><tr>now every breeze terrifies me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Concutiat tenerum quaelibet aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 650</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n4532.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4532.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a breeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wind</hi> (even when violent): <cit><quote lang="la">Et reserata viget genitabilis aura Favoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: Aura parit flores tepidi fecunda Favoni. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 282</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, Aspice, ventosi ceciderunt murmuris aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae Vela vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura post meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis, ib. Job, 4, 16: petulans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignarae,</quote> <trans><tr>brutish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 164</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Ellis: <cit><quote lang="la">rapida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:586" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes eos tollet aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:57:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 57, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.—Also <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas exsuscitat aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:507" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 507</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: dum flavit velis aura secunda meis, <hi rend="ital">while a favorable breeze breathed on my sails</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">so long as I was in prosperity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam opinionem parva non numquam commutat aura rumoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis famae aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem neque periculi tempestas neque honoris aura potuit umquam de suo cursu aut spe aut metu demovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi aurā spei objectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat sibi auram posse aliquam adflari in hoc crimine voluntatis defensionisque eorum, quibus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>token of favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescius aurae (sc. amoris) Fallacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta Cupidinis aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence freq. aura popularis, <hi rend="ital">the popular breeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popular favor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:45:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 45, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 45</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">aura favoris popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium gaudens popularibus auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 816</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adliciendo ad se plebem jam aurā non consilio ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.5" n="C. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The air</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Nubila portabunt venti transversa per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tenvis enim quaedam moribundos deserit aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurarumque leves animae calidique vapores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anima) discedit in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 400</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1129" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1129</bibl> et saep.—Hence, aurae aëris or aëriae aurae freq. in Lucr.: (res) Aëris in teneras possint proferrier auras, 1, 207; 1, 783; 1, 801; 1, 803; 1, 1087; 2, 203; 3, 456; 3, 570; 3, 591; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 693: liquidissimus aether Atque levissimus aërias super influit auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 501</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:771" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 771</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:933" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 933</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nulla nec aërias volucris perlabitur auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:127" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui tamen aërias telum contorsit in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 520</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the vital air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vivit et aetherias vitalīs suscipit auras,</quote> <trans><tr>breathes a breath of ethereal air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 405</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Verg.: haud invisus caelestibus auras Vitales carpis, A. 1, 387: vesci vitalibus auris, i. e. vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 857</bibl></cit>; imitated by Verg., A. 1, 546, and 3, 339; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haurire auram communem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">12: captare naribus auras,</quote> <trans><tr>to snuff the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 376</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: libertatis auram captare, <hi rend="ital">to catch at the air of freedom</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to seize upon any hope of liberty</hi>, Liv 3, 37, 1.—</sense><sense id="n4532.7" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4532.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The upper air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assurgere in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 109</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se laetus ad auras Palmes agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad auras Aetherias tendit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 291</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 445</bibl>: stat ferrea turris ad auras, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for ad alta, <hi rend="ital">rises high</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 554</bibl>: Sorbet <cb n="AURE" /> in abruptum fluctus, rursusque sub auras Erigit alternos, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 422</bibl>; 7, 466; 2, 759; 5, 427 al.; cf. Wagner, Quaest. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> X. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.9" n="b" level="4"> In opp. to the lower world, <hi rend="ital">the upper world</hi> (cf. aether, I. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">Eurydice superas veniebat ad auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 486</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ortygiam, quae me superas eduxit prima sub auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 641</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 11</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 481</bibl>: ad superos); <cit><quote lang="la">so of childbirth: pondus in auras expulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 704</bibl></cit>.—In gen. for <hi rend="ital">publicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daylight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre sub auras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere ad auras,</quote> <trans><tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 259</bibl></cit>: fugere auras, <hi rend="ital">to seclude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hide one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 388</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.10" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to other atmospheric objects which exert an influence on bodies, as <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n4532.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bright light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">fa/eos a)u+tmh/</foreign>, Callim. Hymn. Dian. 117): <cit><quote lang="la">discolor unde auri per ramos aura refulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 204</bibl></cit> (splendor auri, Serv.).—</sense><sense id="n4532.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The warmth of sunlight</hi>: solis calidior visa est aura, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si modo damnatum revocaverit aura puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:23:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 23, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illi Nomen ab extremis fontibus aura refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 20, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4532.14" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhalation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inolentis olivi Naturam, nullam quae mittat naribus auram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illi Dulcis compositis spiravit crinibus aura,</quote> <trans><tr>a sweet odor exhaled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 417</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:65" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:589" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 589</bibl>; cf. Heins. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 394</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tantum notas odor attulit auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues ab ovilibus aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:46" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurarius: <entryFree id="n4533" type="main" key="aura_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum</etym>. <sense id="n4533.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold-</hi>: statera, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 455, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metalla,</quote> <trans><tr>gold-mines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornax,</quote> <trans><tr>for smelting gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 13, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: canon, <hi rend="ital">a tax upon purchase and sale</hi>, Cod. 10, 47, 10; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auraria pensitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 61, 2</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> auraria, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 6, 29</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4533.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4533.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurārĭ-us</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a worker in gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a goldsmith</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3096</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4533.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n4533.4" n="a" level="4"> (Sc. fodina.) <hi rend="ital">A gold-mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n4533.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A female worker in gold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a golddealer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4065</bibl> (v. Orell. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4534" type="gloss" key="aura_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a patron</hi> [aura, II. B.], acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 817</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurata: <entryFree id="n4535" type="main" key="aura_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurāta</orth>, v. <itype>auro</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
auratilis: <entryFree id="n4536" type="hapax" key="aura_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurātĭlis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">e</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auratus</etym>, <sense id="n4536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gold-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulviculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
aurator: <entryFree id="n4537" type="gloss" key="aura_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruswth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gilder</hi>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
auratura: <entryFree id="n4538" type="main" key="aura_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aurum</etym>, <sense id="n4538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gilding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 28</bibl>; and besides only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 583, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auratus: <entryFree id="n4539" type="main" key="aura_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>auro</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
aurea: <entryFree id="n4540" type="gloss" key="aure^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>auris</etym>, <sense id="n4540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bridle of a horse</hi>: aureas dicebant frenos, quibus equorum aures religantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> s. v. aureax, p. 8.</sense></entryFree>
aureatus: <entryFree id="n4541" type="hapax" key="aure^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aureus</etym>, <sense id="n4541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorated with gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris hederā ter aureatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 396</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aureax: <entryFree id="n4542" type="gloss" key="aureax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aureax</orth>, v. auriga <sense id="n4542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aurelianus: <entryFree id="n4543" type="main" key="Aure_li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurēlĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n4543.0" n="I" level="1"> Flavius Claudius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor who reigned</hi> A. D. 270-275; his life was written by Vopiscus; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 489</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1026</bibl> sq.; 1535; 1856.—</sense><sense id="n4543.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4543.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurēlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Aurelian</hi>: sodales, <hi rend="ital">a college of priests like the</hi> Augustales, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Anton. Philos. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">BALNEVM,</quote> <trans><tr>built by Aurelian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 178, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4543.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurēlĭānensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: urbs, the present <hi rend="ital">Orleans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurelius: <entryFree id="n4544" type="main" key="Aure_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurēlĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausēlĭus</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n4544.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman</hi> nomen, e. g. M. Aurelius Antoninus, L. Aurelius Cotta; hence, </sense><sense id="n4544.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4544.2" n="1" level="3"> Aurelia Via, <hi rend="ital">the Aurelian Way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made by a certain Aurelius</hi>, otherwise unknown; <cit><quote lang="la">it consisted of two parts: VETVS ET NOVA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3307</bibl></cit>; the former ran from the Porta Janiculensis (now <hi rend="ital">Porta di S. Pancrazio</hi>) of the northern coast to Pisa, later to Arelate; the latter was a small branch which led from the Porta Aurelia (now <hi rend="ital">Castel S. Angelo</hi>) four thousand paces, to the former The <hi rend="ital">via vetus</hi> Cicero mentions in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; Phil. 12, 9.—</sense><sense id="n4544.3" n="2" level="3"> Aurelia lex. </sense><sense id="n4544.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Judiciaria, <hi rend="ital">of the prœtor</hi> L. Aurelius Cotta (A. U. C. 684), acc. to which the Senatores, Equites, and Tribuni aerarii were invested with judicial power, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Div. in Caecil. 3" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Div. in Caecil. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4544.5" n="(b)" level="5"> De ambitu,<pb n="207" /> <cb n="AURI" />  of unknown origin, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4544.6" n="3" level="3"> Forum Aurelium, <hi rend="ital">a town in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Via Aurelia, <hi rend="ital">near the present village Castellacio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 370.—</sense><sense id="n4544.7" n="4" level="3"> Aurelium tribunal, <hi rend="ital">in the forum</hi>, of unknown origin (perh, made by L. Aurelius Cotta), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Quir. 5, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Gradus Aurelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4544.8" n="II" level="1"> Sextus Aurelius Victor, <hi rend="ital">a Roman historian of the fourth century;</hi> cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 342 sq.; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 408.</sense></entryFree>
aureolus: <entryFree id="n4545" type="main" key="aure^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n4545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [aureus]. </sense><sense id="n4545.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4545.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">au-rĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus), <hi rend="ital">a gold coin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:36" default="NO">12, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4545.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ornamented with gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilded</hi>: cinctus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 553, 2</bibl>: laquearia, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ stef</foreign>. 9, 196.—</sense><sense id="n4545.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gold-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4545.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureoli pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non magnus, verum aureolus et ad verbum ediscendus libellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratiuncula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auresco: <entryFree id="n4546" type="hapax" key="auresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n4546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [aurum], <hi rend="ital">to become of the color of gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër aurescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 83</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
aureus: <entryFree id="n4547" type="main" key="aure^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n4547.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4547.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">aureolus, auratus, aurifer): patera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 104</bibl></cit> and 263: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1154</bibl></cit>: torques. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:41:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 41, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala Hesperidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona (a gift for distinction in war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 363</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3453</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3475</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: nummus, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the standard gold coin of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gold piece</hi> (first struck in the second Punic war), of the value of 25 denarii or 100 sestertii (weighing about 120 grains, and being about equal to £1, 1<hi rend="ital">s.</hi> 1<hi rend="ital">d.</hi> or $5.10), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 8</bibl>: si (tibi) contigit aureus unus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 122</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">fully, aureus nummus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 7 al.</bibl>—Of the Hebrew <hi rend="ital">shekels</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 9, 15</bibl>; 9, 16.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis aurea tinxit Flumen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the power of changing every thing to gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4547.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Furnished with gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interwoven</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ornamented with gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victimam auream polcram immolabat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with gilded horns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit> (cf. Hom. Od. 3, 426): <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 347</bibl></cit>. templa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pactolus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose waters flowed with gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 87</bibl></cit>; cf: Lucr 5, 911 sq.—</sense><sense id="n4547.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering like gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidi color aureus ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Barba erat incipiens, barbae color aureus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12,
