395</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 461</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurea Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 431</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 723</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:448" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 448</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod 17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureus sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G 1, 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 51</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 663</bibl>: sidera, Verg A. 2, 488; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 832: caesaries,</quote> <trans><tr>golden locks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:659" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 95</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 71</bibl></cit>, and 8, 52: Aurea pavonum ridenti imbuta lepore Saecla, <hi rend="ital">the golden species of peacock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of laughing beauty</hi>, Lucr 2, 502.—</sense><sense id="n4547.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of physical and mental excellences or attractions, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 16</bibl></cit>; Ov M. 10, 277; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 761: Amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurea Phoebi porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:29:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:80" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:5 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 5 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta, vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> and 13: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui nunc te fruitur credulus aureā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua mater Me movet atque iras aurea vincit anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritas,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden mean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:64" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Virgo = Astraea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurichalcum: <entryFree id="n4548" type="main" key="auri^chalcum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭchalcum</orth>, v. orichalcum.</entryFree>
auricilla: <entryFree id="n4549" type="main" key="auri^cilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭcilla</orth>, v. oricilla.</entryFree>
auricoctor: <entryFree id="n4550" type="gloss" key="auri^coctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭcoctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aurum-coctor</etym>, <cb n="AURI" /> <sense id="n4550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that melts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refines gold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 976, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auricolor: <entryFree id="n4551" type="hapax" key="auri^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭ-cŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum</etym>, <sense id="n4551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the color of gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> Evang. Bapt. Chr. 1, 359</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auricomans: <entryFree id="n4552" type="hapax" key="auri^co^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭ-cŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with golden hair</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">xrusoko/mhs</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auricomus: <entryFree id="n4553" type="main" key="auri^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum-coma</etym>, <sense id="n4553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with golden hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:92" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Batavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:608" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 608</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with golden foliage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus (arboris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auricula: <entryFree id="n4554" type="main" key="auri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭcŭla</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭcŭla</orth>, Trog. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 276</bibl>; Balliol MS. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl> (Ellis ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 2</bibl>); cf. Fest. s. v. orata, p. 183 Müll.; cf. aurum <sense id="n4554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>auris</etym>. </sense><sense id="n4554.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The external ear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ear-lap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine te prendam auriculis, sine dem suavium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praehende auriculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculam fortasse mordicus abstulisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 40, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 14, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 18, 26</bibl>.—On account of its softness, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculā infimā mollior,</quote> <trans><tr>softer than the earlap</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4554.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the ear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omne Humanum genus est avidum nimis auricularum,</quote> <trans><tr>have too itching ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 594</bibl></cit>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 17, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auricularius: <entryFree id="n4555" type="main" key="auri^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭcŭlārĭus</orth>. (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>like oricula for auricula</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:30:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 30, 3 al.</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>auricula</etym>. <sense id="n4555.0" n="I" level="1"> Medicus, <hi rend="ital">an aurist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4, 227</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4555.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A counsellor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4555.2" n="III" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">w)takousth/s</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
aurifer: <entryFree id="n4556" type="main" key="auri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n4556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">containing gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goldbearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): amnis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pactolus</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Spain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:25" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio, Flor 4, 12, 60: harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: arbor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bearing golden apples</hi> (in the garden of the Hesperides), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:639" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 639</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurifex: <entryFree id="n4557" type="main" key="auri^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aurum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n4557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker in gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goldsmith</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 68</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 3, 8; 3, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 40, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aurifluus: <entryFree id="n4558" type="hapax" key="auri_^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurī^flŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n4558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing with gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tagus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 604</bibl></cit> (cf.: Tanti tibi non sit opaci Omnis harena Tagi quodque in mare volvitur aurum, Juv 3, 55).</sense></entryFree>
aurifodina: <entryFree id="n4559" type="main" key="auri^fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭ-fŏdīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n4559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [aurum], <hi rend="ital">a goldmine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
auriga: <entryFree id="n4560" type="main" key="auri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">aureax</orth>, Paul. ex Fest p. 8 Müll.), <gen>comm.</gen> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 677</bibl> P.) [aureaago], pr., <sense id="n4560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that handles the reins.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4560.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A charioteer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driver</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">agitator, agaso),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 624</bibl></cit>; Hor C. 1, 15, 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 12, 37</bibl>; Vulg 3 Reg. 22, 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 18, 13</bibl> al.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a groom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 85</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec currus usquam videt aurigamque sororem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 918</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">one who contended in the chariot-race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a charioteer in the games of the circus</hi> (the four parties of whom were distinguished by the colors, Veneta, <hi rend="ital">blue</hi>, Prasina, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>, Alba, <hi rend="ital">white</hi>, and Russea sive Russata, <hi rend="ital">red;</hi> cf <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var 3, 51</bibl>; Gesn. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 6, 2</bibl>): auriga indoctus, Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 292, 32</bibl> (p. 328 Mos.); so Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:43" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Calig. 54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Vit. 12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Dom. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4560.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4560.3" n="1" level="3"> As a constellation, <hi rend="ital">the Wagoner</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">(*hnio/xos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:73" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 73</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4560.4" n="2" level="3"> Poet, <hi rend="ital">a pilot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helmsman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurigam video vela dedisse rati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4560.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut auriga rectrixque membrorum anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurigalis: <entryFree id="n4561" type="hapax" key="auri_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auriga</etym>, <sense id="n4561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a charioteer</hi>: corrigia, Edict. Dioclet. p. 26.</sense></entryFree>
aurigans: <entryFree id="n4562" type="hapax" key="auri_gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, as if from aurigo, āre [aurum], <sense id="n4562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glittering with gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:58" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
aurigarius: <entryFree id="n4563" type="main" key="auri_ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>auriga</etym> (for the class. auriga), <sense id="n4563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charioteer in the races of the circus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2596</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurigatio: <entryFree id="n4564" type="main" key="auri_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aurigo</etym>, <sense id="n4564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving of a chariot in the course</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the dolphin: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus, gestationes, aurigationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>. <cb n="AURI" /></sense></entryFree>
aurigator: <entryFree id="n4565" type="main" key="auri_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (for the class. auriga), <sense id="n4565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who contends in the chariotrace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 340, 3</bibl>.—As a constellation, <hi rend="ital">the Wagoner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Phaen. Arat. 405</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurigena: <entryFree id="n4566" type="main" key="Auri^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>aurum-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n4566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sprung</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced from gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold-begotten</hi>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Perseus, as son of Danaë <cit><quote lang="la">by Jupiter transformed into a shower of gold,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 250</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 6, 14</bibl> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">xruso/patros</foreign>, Lycophr. 838).</sense></entryFree>
auriger: <entryFree id="n4567" type="main" key="auri^ge^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭgĕr</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurumgero</etym>, <sense id="n4567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with gilded horns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 30, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <trans><tr>on which the golden fleece hung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:110" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurigineus: <entryFree id="n4568" type="hapax" key="auri_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgĭnĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aurūgĭn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurugo</etym>, <sense id="n4568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jaundiced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auriginosus: <entryFree id="n4569" type="gloss" key="auri_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgĭnōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aurūgĭn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jaundiced</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">i)kteriko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Graec. Lat.; cf. Apul. Orth. Fragm. 41 Osann.</sense></entryFree>
aurigo: <entryFree id="n4570" type="main" key="auri_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 70, 17</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>auriga</etym>, <sense id="n4570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a charioteer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a contender in the chariot-race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive a chariot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contend in the chariot-race.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4570.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Suet.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4570.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo natura aurigatur non necessitudo, Varr. ap. Non. l. l.: si (homines) nihil suā sponte faciunt, sed ducentibus stellis et aurigantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurigor: <entryFree id="n4571" type="main" key="auri_gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurīgor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. aurigo <sense id="n4571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aurilegulus: <entryFree id="n4572" type="main" key="auri^le^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭlĕgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aurum-lego</etym>, <sense id="n4572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gold-picker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold-collector</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 19, 9; Paul Nol. Carm. 17 ad Nic. 269.</sense></entryFree>
aurinia: <entryFree id="n4573" type="main" key="Aurini^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurinĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prophetess held in great veneration by the Germans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Rupert.</sense></entryFree>
aurinini: <entryFree id="n4574" type="main" key="Aurini_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurinīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an older name for</hi> Saturnini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auripigmentum: <entryFree id="n4575" type="main" key="auri^pigmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭ-pigmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>aurum</etym>, <sense id="n4575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">orpiment;</hi> composed of arsenic, sulphur, and earth, of a brilliant yellow color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 22, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auris: <entryFree id="n4576" type="main" key="auris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auris</orth> (<case>abl.</case>, aure, auri), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. audio</etym>. <sense id="n4576.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the ear</hi> as the organ of hearing, while auricula is the external ear, <foreign lang="greek">to\ ou)=s</foreign>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 506, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 486</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 1, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. antestor.—In comic style: Face, sis, vocivas aedīs aurium,</quote> <trans><tr>make the chambers of your ears vacant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. aedes.—Hence (usu. <number>plur.</number>, aures): <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be attentive</tr>, <tr>to listen to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admovere aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to lend an ear</tr>, <tr>listen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 413" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 413</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:419" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 72</bibl>: praebere aures, Liv 38, 52, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 8, 3: praebuimus longis ambagibus aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 692</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 334</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl>; 15, 465; and: praebere aurem (esp. in the signif., <hi rend="ital">to incline the ears in order to hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to listen to</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:821" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 821</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 6, 28 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inclinare aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 19, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus accipere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:982" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 982</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:164" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 50, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 62 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus percipite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te cupidā captat aure maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">auribus aëra captat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 787</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 309</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 32 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl></cit> et saep.—Particular phrases: in or ad aurem, also in aure, dicere, admonere, etc., <hi rend="ital">to say something in the ear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whisper in the ear</hi>: in aurem Pontius, Scipio, inquit, vide quid agas, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 12</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:90" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Voluptati ministrarent et eam tantum ad aurem admonerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: in aure dictare, Juv 11, 59: aurem vellere, <hi rend="ital">to pull</hi>, as an admonition: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthius aurem Vellit et admonuit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>admonished</tr>, <tr>reminded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pervellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94</bibl>: dare or servire auribus, <hi rend="ital">to gratify the ears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, Treb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 27</bibl>: in <pb n="208" /> <cb n="AURO" /> utramvis or in dextram aurem dormire, <hi rend="ital">to sleep soundly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be unconcerned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 101</bibl> (cf. Menaud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">)*ep)a)mfote/ran... me/llei kaqeudh/sein</foreign>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 29</bibl>: aures alicujus aperire (eccl. Lat., after the Heb.), <hi rend="ital">to open one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s ears</hi>, i. e. to restore his hearing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 7, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4576.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4576.2" n="A" level="2"> </sense><sense id="n4576.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The hearing</hi>, so far as it judges of the euphony of a discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">offendent aures, quarum est judicium superbissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>; so Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 23, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticorum aures teretes et religiosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 32, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 387</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4576.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Hearers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auditors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum tibi sol tepidus plures admoverit aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 19</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n4576.5" n="B" level="2"> Also, from its shape, <hi rend="ital">the ear of a plough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mould-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">earthboard by which the furrow is widened and the earth turned back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 172</bibl>; cf. Voss ad h. 1.; Smith, Dict. Antiq., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auriscalpium: <entryFree id="n4577" type="main" key="auriscalpi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auriscalpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>auris-scalpo</etym>. <sense id="n4577.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ear-pick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4577.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surgical instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a probe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 41" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:228" default="NO">228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:230" default="NO">230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auritulus: <entryFree id="n4578" type="hapax" key="auri_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurītŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>auritus</etym>, <sense id="n4578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the long-eared</hi> animal, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the ass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auritus: <entryFree id="n4579" type="main" key="auri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auris</etym>. <sense id="n4579.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Furnished with ears</hi> (acc. to auris, l.), <hi rend="ital">having long</hi> or <hi rend="ital">large ears</hi>: auritus a magnis auribus dicitur, ut sunt asinorum et leporum, alias ab audiendi facultate, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 308</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">asellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si meus aurita gaudet glaucopide Flaccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the longeared animal, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the hare</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Phaen. Arat. 788</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4579.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4579.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Attentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">face jam nunc tu, praeco, omnem auritum poplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis Nostro consilio venator assit cum auritis plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—So of the trees and walls which listened to the music of Orpheus and Amphion's lyre: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4579.3" n="2" level="3"> Testis auritus, <hi rend="ital">a witness by hearsay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who has only heard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 8</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n4579.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (as if <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> of aurio, īre), <hi rend="ital">heard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apol. 835</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n4579.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Formed like the ear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ear-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurita aduncitas rostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 136</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n4579.6" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to auris, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Furnished with an ear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mould-board</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auro: <entryFree id="n4580" type="main" key="auro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>aurum</etym>, <sense id="n4580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overlay with gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gild</hi>: a metallorum quoque nominibus solent nasci verba, ut ab auro auro, auras; <cit><quote lang="la">ab aere aero, aeras, unde aeratus et auratus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 828</bibl></cit> P.—As <hi rend="ital">finite verb</hi> only in one (doubtful) example in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron. Mil. 12</bibl>.—But very freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4580.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Furnished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlaid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ornamented with gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilt</hi>: auratus aries Colchorum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurata metalla,</quote> <trans><tr>metals rich in gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with a golden helmet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12:57" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12, 57</bibl></cit>: sinus, <hi rend="ital">ornamented with a golden buckle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pin</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:310" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8</bibl></cit>. 448: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:263" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 263</bibl></cit>: stolae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <trans><tr>with golden shields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auratior hostia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4580.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 470</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regum auratis circumdata colla catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4580.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gold-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma nunc sanguineis, nunc auratis guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 179</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrāta</orth>, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 182 sq. Müll.; cf. aurum <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Gr. 1, p. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gr. 1, p. 59</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gilt-bream</hi>: Sparus aurata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2</bibl>. 18; 2, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 25, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:90" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurora: <entryFree id="n4581" type="greek" key="auro_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to Curtius, a reduplicated form for ausosa, from Sanscr. ush, to burn; cf. <foreign lang="greek">au)/ws = hw/s</foreign>, dawn; <foreign lang="greek">h(/lios</foreign>, the sun; and Etrusc. Usil, the god of the sun; but its idea of brightness, splendor, easily connects it with the same group as aurum; v. aes</etym>. <sense id="n4581.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The dawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daybreak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morning</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): est autem aurora diei clarescentis exordium et primus splendor aëris, quae Graece <foreign lang="greek">h)w/s</foreign> dicitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 31, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ab aurorā ad hoc quod diei est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec nox ulla diem neque noctem aurora secutast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 578</bibl></cit>; <cb n="AURU" /> 4, 538; 4, 711; 5, 657; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad primam auroram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4581.1" n="B" level="2"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of the morning</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">)*hw/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Hyperion</hi> (hence Hyperionis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:159" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 159</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">wife of Tithonus</hi> (hence Tithonia conjunx, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:403" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 403</bibl>, and Tithonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:943" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 943</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">and mother of Memnon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora novo cum spargit lumine terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 144</bibl></cit>; imitated by Verg. l.l.; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 459: Iamque rubescebat stellis Aurora fugatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 3:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 521</bibl></cit>; 6, 535; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 26: Proxima prospiciet Tithono Aurora relicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:461" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:576 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 576 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">she robbed Procris of her husband, Cephalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 703</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but gave him back,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:713" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 713</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4581.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the East</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Orient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Aurorae populis et litore rubro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus ad Auroram Nabataeaque regna recessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (terrae) sunt a Gadibus usque Auroram et Gangen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:606 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 606 sq.</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laus Seren. Reg. 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutr. 1, 427</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>the people of the East</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Rufin. 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Gild. 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutr. 2, 527</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurosus: <entryFree id="n4582" type="main" key="auro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum</etym>, <sense id="n4582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the color of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like gold</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurugineus: <entryFree id="n4583" type="hapax" key="auru_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurūgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurugo</etym>, <sense id="n4583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jaundiced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurugino: <entryFree id="n4584" type="hapax" key="auru_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurūgĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be affected with the jaundice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the jaundice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurugo: <entryFree id="n4585" type="main" key="auru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <sense id="n4585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [aurum]. </sense><sense id="n4585.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The jaundice</hi> (from its color), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurugo, quam quidam regium, quidam arquatum morbum vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 110" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:127" default="NO">127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 85</bibl>; cf. Apul. Orth. § 41; hence, <hi rend="ital">sickly look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paleness</hi>, Vulg Jer. 30, 6.—</sense><sense id="n4585.2" n="II" level="1"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">mildew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 6, 28</bibl>; ib. Amos, 4, 9.</sense></entryFree>
aurula: <entryFree id="n4586" type="main" key="auru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>aura</etym>, <sense id="n4586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gentle breeze;</hi> trop. (in eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">famae aurula,</quote> <trans><tr>a puff of fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 28</bibl></cit> (an imitation of Vergil's tenuis famae aura, A. 7, 646): <cit><quote lang="la">Graecarum litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a whiff of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aurulentus: <entryFree id="n4587" type="hapax" key="auru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aurum</etym>, <sense id="n4587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the color of gold</hi>: lux, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ stef</foreign>. 6, 49.</sense></entryFree>
aurum: <entryFree id="n4588" type="main" key="aurum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aurum</orth> (Sab. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ausum</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 9</bibl> Müll.; vulg. Lat., <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=183" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 183</bibl>; cf. Ital. and Span. oro and Fr. or), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>v. aes</etym>. <sense id="n4588.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Gold;</hi> as a mineral, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 66</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">auri venas invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas auri sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 808</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum igni perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruere terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri fodina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 2, 11</bibl>; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 797</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex auro vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 20</bibl>) et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Provv.: montes auri polliceri,</quote> <trans><tr>to promise mountains of gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carius auro,</quote> <trans><tr>more precious than gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:107:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 107, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <foreign lang="greek">kreissona xrusou=</foreign>, Aesch. Choëph. 372; <foreign lang="greek">xrusou= xruso/tera</foreign>, Sapph. Fr. 122. Ellis).— </sense><sense id="n4588.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4588.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Things made of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ornament of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a golden vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utensil</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec domus argento fulget nec auro renidet,</quote> <trans><tr>gold plate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>. So, </sense><sense id="n4588.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A golden goblet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pleno se proluit auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regales epulae mensis et Bacchus in auro Ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi non committitur aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:27" default="NO">10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:188" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 188</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the hendiadys: pateris libamus et auro = pateris aureis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 192</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4588.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A golden chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buckle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necklace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jewelry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oneratas veste atque auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Donec eum conjunx fatale poposcerit aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 411</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 394</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4588.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A gold ring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ventilet aestivum digitis sudantibus aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4588.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A golden bit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvum mandunt sub dentibus aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 279</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 817</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4588.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The golden fleece</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro Heros Aesonius potitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4588.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A golden hairband</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">krwbu/los</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines nodantur in aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 138</bibl></cit> Serv.—</sense><sense id="n4588.9" n="7" level="3"> Esp. freq., <hi rend="ital">gold as coined money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis illam invenerit Aulam onustam auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">De Caelio vide, quaeso, ne quae lacuna sit in auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurum omnes victā jam pietate colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12:48 sq" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12, 48 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non mortalia pectora cogis Auri sacra fames?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 3, § 6</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2</bibl>, <cb n="AUSC" /> 2, 179; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 3, 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n4588.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The color</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lustre of gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gleam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brightness of gold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 689</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis cristis praesignis et auro (hendiadys, for cristis aureis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevo cum nox accenditur auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:369" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 369</bibl></cit> (i. e. mala portendente splendore, Wagn.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor auri, of the face,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 100</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Ellis.—</sense><sense id="n4588.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Golden Age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeant in aurum Tempora priscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiit argentea proles, Auro deterior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 260</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurunci: <entryFree id="n4589" type="main" key="Aurunci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurunci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Ausones, q.v., = <foreign lang="greek">*au)/rougkoi</foreign> Tzetz. <sense id="n4589.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Aurunci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 318</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 56</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4589.1" n="II. A." level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aurunca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an old town in Campania</hi> (acc. to the fable, built by Auson, the son of Ulysses and Calypso, Fest. s. v. Ausoniam, p. 15): magnus Auruncae alumnus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the satirist Lucilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose paternal city</hi>, Suessa Aurunca, <hi rend="ital">was a colony of the Aurunci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 20</bibl> Rup.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4589.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Au-runcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Aurunca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Auruncian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 795</bibl></cit>: Suessa Aurunca, now <hi rend="ital">Sessa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aurunculeius: <entryFree id="n4590" type="main" key="Auruncu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auruncŭlēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> nomen: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Aurunculeius Cotta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auruspi: <entryFree id="n4591" type="main" key="Auruspi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auruspi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ausculari: <entryFree id="n4592" type="gloss" key="auscu^la_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auscŭlāri</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">auscŭlum</orth>, v. osculor and osculum.</entryFree>
auscultatio: <entryFree id="n4593" type="main" key="ausculta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auscultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ausculto</etym>. <sense id="n4593.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A listening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attending to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auscultatio et publicorum secretorumque inquisitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4593.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An obeying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid mihi scelesto tibi erat auscultatio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auscultator: <entryFree id="n4594" type="main" key="ausculta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auscultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n4594.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listener</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4594.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who obeys</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auscultatus: <entryFree id="n4595" type="main" key="ausculta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auscultātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auscultatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auscultatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont. Verg. p. 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ausculto: <entryFree id="n4596" type="main" key="ausculto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ausculto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n4596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [perh. a union of two roots, that of audio, auris ausis, and of the Sanscr. çru = to hear; v. Bopp, Gloss. p. 396 b.], <hi rend="ital">to hear</hi> any person or thing <hi rend="ital">with attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to listen to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give ear to</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)kroa=sqai</foreign> (cf. audio <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; in the anteclass. per. freq., but not in Lucr.; in the class. per. rare). </sense><sense id="n4596.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Ita est cupidus orationis, ut conducat qui auscultet, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausculto atque animum adverto sedulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">In rem quod sit praevortaris quam re advorsā animo auscultes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis eum ausculto libens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausculta paucis, nisi molestumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 4</bibl> and 5: <cit><quote lang="la">jam scies: Ausculta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 7: illos ausculto lubens, Afran. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 246, 15</bibl>: Nec populum auscultare, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Tob. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: aures diligenter auscultabunt, ib. Isa, 32, 3.—</sense><sense id="n4596.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp </sense><sense id="n4596.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To listen to</hi> something believingly, <hi rend="ital">to give credit to</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n4596.4" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4596.5" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui auscultabant,</quote> <trans><tr>gave heed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4596.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To listen</hi> in secret to something, <hi rend="ital">to overhear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habeat sermonis, auscultabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ego istaec auscultavi ab ostio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4596.7" n="C" level="2"> Of servants, <hi rend="ital">to attend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wait at the door</hi>, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pakou/ein</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fores auscultato atque serva has aedīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: jam dudum ausculto et cupiens tibi dicere servus Pauca, reformido, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 1</bibl> Heind.—</sense><sense id="n4596.8" n="D" level="2"> Alicui or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hear</hi> obediently, <hi rend="ital">to obey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heed</hi> (cf. audio): <cit><quote lang="la">hi auscultare dicuntur, qui auditis parent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 83</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">auscultare est obsequi: audire ignoti quod imperant soleo, non auscultare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 246, 9 sq.</bibl></cit>: magis audiendum quam auscultandum censeo, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Age nunc vincito me auscultato filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui mi auscultabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seni auscultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vin tu homini stulto mi auscultare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 12</bibl>: mihi ausculta: vide, ne tibi desis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: nisi me <pb n="209" /> <cb n="AUSP" /> auscultas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 36</bibl> (we should perhaps here, in accordance with the general idiom, read <hi rend="ital">mi;</hi> so Ritschl).—In <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.: De.</hi> Ad portum ne bitas, dico jam tibi. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Auscultabitur, <hi rend="ital">you shall be obeyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it shall be done</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 127</bibl>.!*? It is difficult to believe, in the verse of Afranius, videt ludos, hinc auscultavi procul, that auscultare is equivalent to videre, spectare, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 246, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auselius: <entryFree id="n4597" type="gloss" key="Ause_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausēlĭus</orth>, v. Aurelius.</entryFree>
auser: <entryFree id="n4598" type="main" key="Auser"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auser</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausar</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 566</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)sar</foreign> (Strabo), <sense id="n4598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary stream of the river Arno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Lucca</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Serchio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 350.</sense></entryFree>
ausetanus: <entryFree id="n4599" type="main" key="Ause_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the city Ausa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausē-tāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ausetani</hi>, Caes B. C. 1, 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 61, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; cf. Mann. Hispan. p. 404.</sense></entryFree>
ausim: <entryFree id="n4600" type="main" key="ausim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ausim</orth>, v. audeo <sense id="n4600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auson: <entryFree id="n4601" type="main" key="Auson"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auson</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, v. Ausones, II. E.</entryFree>
ausona: <entryFree id="n4602" type="main" key="Auso^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of the Ausones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Minturnœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ausones: <entryFree id="n4603" type="main" key="Auso^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)/sones</foreign> [prob. of the same root as Oscus or Opicus, Buttm. and Donald.]. <sense id="n4603.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Ausonians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very ancient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps Greek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name of the primitive inhabitants of Middle and Lower Italy;</hi> of the same import prob. with Aurunci (Aurunici, Auruni = Ausuni, Ausones), Opici, and Osei: cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Ausoniam, p. 18 Müll.; Arist. ap. Polyb. 7, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 727</bibl>; Nieb. Rom. Gesch. 1, p. 71 sq.; Wachsmuth, Röm.
