Gesch. p. 65 sq.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the general name for the inhabitants of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:37" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 37</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4603.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4603.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)soni/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Ausonians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ausonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Lower Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 647</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:290" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 290</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n4603.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4603.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Ausonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, on the southern coast of Italy, between the Iapygian Peninsula and the Sicilian Straits,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 13 sq. —</sense><sense id="n4603.5" n="2" level="3"> In the poets, <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Latin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thybris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:542" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <trans><tr>Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:658" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 350</bibl></cit> (quod in Italiam vergens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>Roman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:P. 2:2:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: os, <hi rend="ital">Ausonian lips</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Roman language</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <trans><tr>the imperial court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 92</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Ausones, <hi rend="ital">the Ausonians</hi>, or, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 834</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4603.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n4603.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Ausonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 564</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4603.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:998" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 998</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4603.9" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ausonian;</hi> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 627 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4603.10" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Auson</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the mythical progenitor of the Ausonians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ulysses and Calypso</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Ausoniam, p. 18 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 171</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausone voce,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Roman</tr>, <tr>Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ausonius: <entryFree id="n4604" type="main" key="Auso^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ausŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; Decimus Magnus Ausonius, <sense id="n4604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grammarian of the fourth century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of the emperor Gratian;</hi> cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 227 sq.; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 414.</sense></entryFree>
auspex: <entryFree id="n4605" type="main" key="auspex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspex</orth>, <itype>spĭcis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>a contraction of avispex, from avis-spicio</etym>, <sense id="n4605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird inspector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bird-seer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who observes the flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">feeding of birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and foretells future events therefrom; an augur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diviner</hi> (in a lit. signif. far more rare than augur). </sense><sense id="n4605.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">latores et auspices legis curiatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cui timebo Providus auspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the birds from which auguries were taken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(galli, gallinacei) victoriarum omnium auspices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>.—Since little of importance was done in Rome without consulting the auspices, hence, </sense><sense id="n4605.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4605.3" n="A. 1." level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divis Auspicibus coeptorum operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dis equidem auspicibus reor etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 45</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:615" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 615</bibl>: auspice Musā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">under the inspiration of the muse</hi>, Hor. Ep. <cb n="AUSP" /> 1, 3, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">Nil desperandum Teucro duce et auspice Teucro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4605.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., as t. t., <hi rend="ital">the person who witnessed the marriage contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the reception of the marriage portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">took care that the marriage ceremonies were rightly performed</hi>, etc., <foreign lang="greek">paranu/mfios</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fere quondam majoris rei nisi auspicato ne privatim quidem gerebatur, quod etiam nunc nuptiarum auspices declarant, qui re omissā nomen tantum tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubit genero socrus nullis auspicibus, nullis auctoribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicum verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nubere dote inter auspices consignatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">veniet cum signatoribus auspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:336" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 336</bibl></cit> Schol.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 371</bibl> Schol.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; cf. pronubus; auctor, II. F. 3.; and Smith, Dict. Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n4605.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4605.6" n="C" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Seren. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auspicabilis: <entryFree id="n4606" type="main" key="auspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auspicor</etym>, <sense id="n4606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of favorable omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auspicalis: <entryFree id="n4607" type="main" key="auspi^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to divination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable for auguries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisciculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. Maxim. 6</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭ-cālĭter</orth> = auspicato, <hi rend="ital">with the appropriate taking of auguries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere gromam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. Constit. p. 153" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. Constit. p. 153</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
auspicato: <entryFree id="n4608" type="main" key="auspi^ca_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātō</orth>, v. auspicor <sense id="n4608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auspicatus: <entryFree id="n4609" type="main" key="auspi^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. auspicor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4610" type="main" key="auspi^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>auspicor</etym>, <sense id="n4610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the taking of auspices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pici in auspicatu magni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 40</bibl></cit> (on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 29, 51</bibl>, v. Moser).</sense></entryFree>
auspicium: <entryFree id="n4611" type="main" key="auspi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>auspex</etym>, <sense id="n4611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divination by observing the flight of birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augury from birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspices</hi> (cf. augurium). </sense><sense id="n4611.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl></cit> (as if overlooking the origin of auspicium): praetor auspicat auspicium prosperum, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 468, 28</bibl>: Dant (Romulus et Remus) operam simul auspicio augurioque etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 81 sq. Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">pullarium in auspicium mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab auspicio bono proficisci, of marriage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 19</bibl></cit> Ellis (cf. auspex, II. A. 2.) et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the class. passages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 4 sq.</bibl>—So auspicium habere, <hi rend="ital">to have the right of taking auspices</hi> (which, in the performance of civil duties, was possessed by all magistrates, but, in time of war, only by the commander - in - chief): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes magistratus auspicium judiciumque habento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nemo plebeius auspicia haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of the commander - in - chief: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnatum oppidumst Imperio atque auspicio mei eri Amphitruonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut gesserit rem publicam ductu, imperio, auspicio suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 2, 25: qui ductu auspicioque ejus res prospere gesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 7, 7</bibl>; 41, 28, 1 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">21, 40, 3: recepta signa ductu Germanici, auspiciis Tiberii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Septentrionalis oceanus navigatus est auspiciis divi Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia ductu meo, alia imperio auspicioque perdomui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domuit partim ductu partim auspiciis suis Cantabriam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—And so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates rege vatis habenas, Auspicio felix totus ut annus eat (sc. tuo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 26</bibl></cit> Merk.—Hence for <hi rend="ital">the chief command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis auspiciis totum confecta duella per orbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 254</bibl></cit> Schmid: <cit><quote lang="la">Illius auspiciis obsessae moenia pacem Victa petent Mutinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 822</bibl></cit>.—And, in gen., <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Me si fata meis paterentur ducere vitam Auspiciis et sponte meā componere curas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Communem hunc ergo populum paribusque regamus Auspiciis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 103</bibl></cit> (aequali potestate, Serv.).—</sense><sense id="n4611.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a divine premonition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">token</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liquido exeo auspicio foras, Avi sinistrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: dicere ausus est optimis auspiciis<cb n="AUST" />  ea geri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae contra rem publicam ferrentur, contra auspicia ferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infaustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—So, auspicium facere, of things which give signs, tokens, omens: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium haec (mustela) facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur aliis a laevā, aliis a dexterā datum est avibus, ut ratum auspicium facere possint?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa summum culmen hominis auspicium fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: cui (diviti) si vitiosa libido Fecerit auspicium, <hi rend="ital">gave him a token</hi> (viz. for changing), <hi rend="ital">urged him to a new decision</hi>, Hor, Ep. 1, 1, 86.—</sense><sense id="n4611.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, = initium, <hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi> (cf. auspicor, II., and auspex, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia belli a parricidio incipientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia regni a parricidio coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auspico: <entryFree id="n4612" type="main" key="auspi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. auspicor <sense id="n4612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auspicor: <entryFree id="n4613" type="main" key="auspi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>from auspex, as auguror from augur</etym>, <sense id="n4613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take the auspices.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4613.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4613.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Gracchus) cum pomerium transiret, auspicari esset oblitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripudio auspicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabio auspicanti aves non addixere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 16, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 41, 5</bibl> sq. al.—</sense><sense id="n4613.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, also with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of a good omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi> (first freq. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis Kal. Januariis auspicandi causā omne genus operis instaurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:98" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicandi gratiā tribunal ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non auspicandi causā, sed studendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicatus est et jurisdictionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicabar in Virginem (aquam) desilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4613.4" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicari culturarum officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:1" default="NO">3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo a suppliciis vitam auspicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatorium per militiam auspicantes gradum,</quote> <trans><tr>attaining</tr>, <tr>receiving it through military services</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 10</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n4613.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to take the auspices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor advenit, auspicat auspicium prosperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit> (Non. p 468, 28): <cit><quote lang="la">(magistratus) publicae [rei] cum auspicant, Caecil. ap. Non. l. l. (Com. Rel. p. 66 Rib.): auspicetis: cras est communis dies, Atta, ib. (Com. Rel. p. 161 Rib.): Non hodie isti rei auspicavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustelam,</quote> <trans><tr>to receive</tr>, <tr>accept as an augury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4613.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4613.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after taking the auspices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus non solum auspicato urbem condidisse, sed ipse etiam optimus augur fuisse traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil fere quondam majoris rei nisi auspicato ne privatim quidem gerebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et consul rogari et augur et auspicato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeius magistratus nullus auspicato creatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">28, 28: Hunc (senatum) auspicato a parente et conditore urbis nostrae institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 72 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n4613.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrated by auguries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicato in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non auspicatos contudit impetus Nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicata comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4613.9" n="(g)" level="5"> Acc. to auspicor, II., <hi rend="ital">begun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello male auspicato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4613.10" n="(d)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, as <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Liviam auspicatis rei publicae ominibus duxisset uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus auspicatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicatissimum exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 28, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">initium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">auspĭcātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">under a good omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspiciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingrediare auspicato,</quote> <trans><tr>at a for tunate moment</tr>, <tr>in a lucky hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haud auspicato huc me appuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui auspicato a Chelidone surrexisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:40:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> auspicatius: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicatius mutare nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
austellus: <entryFree id="n4614" type="hapax" key="austellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>auster</etym>, <sense id="n4614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gentle south wind</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 98, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auster: <entryFree id="n4615" type="main" key="auster1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ush-, to burn; the burning, hot wind</etym>, <sense id="n4615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the south wind</hi> (opp. aquilo, the north wind). </sense><sense id="n4615.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auster fulmine pollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 899</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: nubilus. <pb n="210" /> <cb n="AUST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:56" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 56</bibl>: umidus, <hi rend="ital">bringing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing rain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 462</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 261</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:22:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 22, 16</bibl>: hibernus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 12, 25</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n4615.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the south country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the south</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquilonis austrive partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 25</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 12, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n4616" type="main" key="auster2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auster</orth> = austerus, q. v.</entryFree>
austeralis: <entryFree id="n4617" type="main" key="auste^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austĕrālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a. plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually called</hi> sisymbrium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
austere: <entryFree id="n4618" type="main" key="auste_re_1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austērē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. austerus <sense id="n4618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4622" type="hapax" key="auste_re_2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austērē</orth>, acc. to II., <sense id="n4622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rigidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>: agit mecum austere et Stoice <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Cic. Mur. 35, 74</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: cum aliquo austerius agere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
austeritas: <entryFree id="n4619" type="main" key="auste_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austērĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>austerus</etym> (perh. not before the Aug. period). <sense id="n4619.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4619.1" n="A" level="2"> Of taste, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sourness</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbitas, tristitia, severitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:68" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 11</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 35, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4619.2" n="B" level="2"> Of colors, <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dinginess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 36, § 97</bibl>; 35, 11, 40, § 134.—</sense><sense id="n4619.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a te hanc austeritatem exigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum austeritate imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex bono esse austeritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
austerulus: <entryFree id="n4620" type="hapax" key="auste_ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austērŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n4620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat harsh;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cratera dialecticae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
austerus: <entryFree id="n4621" type="greek" key="auste_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (auster, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 188" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 188</bibl>; <sense id="n4621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> austerrimus, Messala, Corv. Progen. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 5</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">au)sthro/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n4621.1" n="I. A." level="1"> Lit, of taste, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tart</hi> (not before the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: acer, acerbus, tristis, severus, molestus): vinum nigrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austerior gustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba austero sapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 20, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum austerissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 142" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4621.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> *</sense><sense id="n4621.3" n="1" level="3"> Of smell, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsami sucus: odore austerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4621.4" n="2" level="3"> Of color, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt autem colores austeri aut floridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pictor) austerior colore et in austeritate jucundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4621.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4621.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austere</hi> (opp. mol lis, facilis, lenis; <cit><quote lang="la">scarcely before Cic.): illo austero more ac modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">austerior et gravior esse potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec gravis austeri poena cavenda viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:13:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo austerus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 22</bibl>.—Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sit noLis ornatus et suavis orator, ut suavitatem habeat austeram et solidam, non dulcem atque decoctam (the epithet borrowed from wine),</quote> <trans><tr>that he may have a severe and solid</tr>, <tr>not a luscious and effeminate sweetness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austera poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 128</bibl></cit> Spald.—Of style in statuary: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4621.7" n="B" level="2"> As the opp. of kind, pleasant, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irksome</hi> (so first after the beginning of the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quaelibet austeras de me ferat urna tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:11:49" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 11, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger omnem austeram curationem recusans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 28, § 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>:</sense></entryFree>
australis: <entryFree id="n4623" type="main" key="austra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1.auster, II.</etym>, <sense id="n4623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">austrinus, meridianus): quae (regio) tum est aquilonia tum australis, Cic N D. 2, 19, 50: cingulus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the torrid zone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora, the same,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Exod 40, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <trans><tr>the south pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> P 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>Egyptian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 1, 403</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
austrania: <entryFree id="n4624" type="main" key="Austra_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Austrānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island to the north of Germany</hi>, also called <hi rend="ital">Glessaria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the island of Ameland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in West Friesland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 97</bibl> (<hi rend="ital">Austeravia</hi>, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
austrifer: <entryFree id="n4625" type="hapax" key="austri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1.austerfero</etym>, <sense id="n4625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing the south wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
austrinus: <entryFree id="n4626" type="main" key="austri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. auster, II.</etym>, <sense id="n4626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; also freq. in post-Aug. prose; esp. in Pliny; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: australis, meridianus): calores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>on which the south wind blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit>. 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis (a constellation),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:63" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <trans><tr>the south pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:68:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 68, 68</bibl></cit>, <cb n="AUT" /> § 172 al.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">austrīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">the southern regions of a country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Austrina Cypri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardiniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadociae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
austro: <entryFree id="n4627" type="gloss" key="Austro_1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Austrō</orth> - <itype>Afrĭcus, i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. auster</etym>, <sense id="n4627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the south - southwest wind</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*aibo/notos</foreign>, between Auster and Africus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 11, 7</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> call it Libonotos, and the latter says: Libonotos, qui apud nos sine nomine est).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4628" type="gloss" key="austro_2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">austrō</orth>-nŏtius, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (sc. polus), <sense id="n4628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the south pole</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 5, 5</bibl> (in the latter passage also <orth extent="full" lang="la">austrō</orth>-nŏtus).</sense></entryFree>
ausum: <entryFree id="n4629" type="main" key="ausum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ausum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>audeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
ausus: <entryFree id="n4630" type="main" key="ausus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>audeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4631" type="main" key="ausus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ausus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>audeo</etym>, <sense id="n4631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hazard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123, 184</bibl>; Impp. Leo et Anthem. Cod. 1, 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
aut: <entryFree id="n4632" type="main" key="aut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aut</orth>, <sense id="n4632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [aut, Osc. auti, Umbr. ote, ute, may be a modification of autem, as at of et, the suffix -t being a relic of the demonstrative -tem, which appears in item, and is the same as -dem in quidem, and -dam in quondam, and of which the demonstrative adverbs, tam and tum, are absolute forms; the first part of these words may be compared with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">au)=</foreign> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">au)=te</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">au)ta/r</foreign>), and with the Sanscr. vā = or, with which again may be compared ve and vel; v. Corss. Ausspr. II. p. 595, and also pp. 130, 223, 411], <hi rend="ital">or;</hi> and repeated: aut... aut, <hi rend="ital">either... or;</hi> so in Sanscr. vā... vā. </sense><sense id="n4632.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. it puts in the place of a previous assertion another, objectively and absolutely antithetical to it, while <hi rend="ital">vel</hi> indicates that the contrast rests upon subjective opinion or choice; i. e. <hi rend="ital">aut</hi> is objective, <hi rend="ital">vel</hi> subjective, or <hi rend="ital">aut</hi> excludes one term, <hi rend="ital">vel</hi> makes the two indifferent. </sense><sense id="n4632.2" n="a" level="4"> Used singly, <hi rend="ital">or</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia bene sunt ei dicenda, qui hoc se posse profitetur aut eloquentiae nomen relinquendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusnam manibus aut quibus viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vinceris aut vincis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cita mors venit aut victoria laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruminat herbas aut aliquam in magno sequitur grege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 55</bibl></cit> et persaep. (cf. on the contrary, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8</bibl>: quae neque confirmare argumentis, neque refellere in animo est: ex ingenio suo quisque demat vel addat fidem).—</sense><sense id="n4632.3" n="b" level="4"> Repeated, aut ... aut, <hi rend="ital">either... or</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubi enim potest illa aetas aut calescere vel apricatione melius vel igni, aut vicissim umbris aquisve refrigerari salubrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam ejus per unam, ut audio, aut vivam aut moriar sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3,1,11 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut, quicquid igitur eodem modo concluditur, probabitis, aut ars ista nulla est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem planitiae aut Jovis templum aut oppidum tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra in universum aut silvis horrida aut paludibus foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc bellum quis umquam arbitraretur aut ab omnibus imperatoribus uno anno aut omnibus annis ab uno imperatore confici posse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11,31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.4" n="c" level="4"> More than twice repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">aut equos Alere aut canes ad venandum, aut ad philosophos, Ter And. 1, 1, 29: Uxor, si cesses, aut te amare cogitat Aut tete amare aut potare atque animo obsequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 7 sq.</bibl></cit>; so four times in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:935 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 935 sq.</bibl>; five times in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 30</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:21:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 21, 26</bibl> sqq.; and six times in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 9, § 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.5" n="d" level="4"> Sometimes double disjunctive phrases with aut... aut are placed together: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsentior Crasso, ne aut de C. Laelii soceri mei aut de hujus generi aut arte aut gloriā detraham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa et rei publicae tempus aut me ipsum, quod nolim, aut alium quempiam aut invitabit aut dehortabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 39, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.6" n="e" level="4"> Repeated after negatives: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aut ille alserit Aut ceciderit atque aliquid praefregerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tanti facinoris immanitas aut exstitisse aut non vindicata esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim sunt aut obscura aut non multa post commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec milites ad scelus missos aut numero validos aut animo promptos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec erit mirabilis illic Aut Stratocles aut cum molli Demetrius Haemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:98 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 98 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aut quis esset ante detexit aut gubernatorem cedere adversae tempestati passus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>; <cb n="AUT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec aut Persae aut Macedones dubitavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: Non sum aut tam inhumanus aut tam alienus a Sardis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil est tam aut fragile aut flexibile quam etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4632.7" n="f" level="4"> In interrogations: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo aut geometres cernere ea potest, quae aut nulla sunt aut internosci a falsis non possunt aut is, qui fidibus utitur, explere numeros et conficere versus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.8" n="g" level="4"> In comparative clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">talis autem simulatio vanitati est conjunctior quam aut liberalitati aut honestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.9" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4632.10" n="A" level="2"> Placed singly, to connect to something more important that which is less so, <hi rend="ital">or at least.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4632.11" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Incute vim ventis submersasque obrue puppes, Aut age diversos et dissice corpora ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:69 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 69 sq.</bibl></cit> Rib. (furens Juno et irata, quod gravissimum credebat, optavit, deinde quod secundum intulit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 411</bibl> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaero, num injuste aut improbe fecerit,</quote> <trans><tr>or at least unfairly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se postulari aut exspectari aliquid suspicantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re vi aut clam agendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>or at least by stealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto cuncti aut magna pars Siccensium fidem mutavissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Audendum est aliquid universis aut omnia singulis patienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars a centurionibus aut praetoriarum cohortium militibus caesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiā suā numquam aut raro ad impotentiam usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.12" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">certe</hi>, etc., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, F. 2.—</sense><sense id="n4632.13" n="B" level="2"> To connect something which must take place, if that which is previously stated does not, <hi rend="ital">or</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the contrary case</hi>, = alioqui: <cit><quote lang="la">Redduc uxorem, aut quam obrem non opus sit cedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (principium) nec nasci potest nec mori, aut concidat omne caelum etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit> (Seyffert ad h. l., but preferring <hi rend="ital">ut non;</hi> B. and K. and Kühner, <hi rend="ital">vel</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc manet insontem gravis exitus: aut ego veri Vana feror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effodiuntur bulbi ante ver: aut deteriores fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mutatione recreabitur sicut in cibis... Aut dicant iste mihi, quae sit alia ratio discendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO">2, 17, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.14" n="C" level="2"> To restrict or correct an expression which is too general or inaccurate, <hi rend="ital">or</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or more accurately.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4632.15" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hominum genere, aut omnino de animalium loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aut scilicet tua libertas disserendi amissa est, aut tu is es, qui in disputando non tuum judicium sequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: cenaene causā, aut tuae mercedis gratiā Nos nostras aedīs postulas comburere? <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 11</bibl>.—In this signification aut sometimes begins a new clause: Potestne igitur quisquam dicere, inter eum, qui doleat, et inter eum, qui in voluptate sit, nihil interesse? Aut, ita qui sentiet, non apertissime insaniat? <hi rend="ital">or is not rather</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid est enim temeritate turpius? Aut quid tam temerarium tamque indignum sapientis gravitate atque constantiā, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4632.16" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">potius</hi> (v. infra, F. 4.).—</sense><sense id="n4632.17" n="D" level="2"> Neque ... aut sometimes, but chiefly in the poets, takes the place of neque... neque: Neque ego hanc abscondere furto Speravi, ne finge, fugam; <cit><quote lang="la">nec conjugis umquam Praetendi taedas aut haec in foedera veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si neque avaritiam neque sordes aut mala lustra Obiciet vere quisquam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 68</bibl></cit> Bentl., but <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>, K. and H.: <cit><quote lang="la">Nunc neque te longi remeantem pompa triumphi Excipit aut sacras poscunt Capitolia lauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam neque plebeiam aut dextro sine numine cretam Servo animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neque enim Tyriis Cynosura carinis Certior aut Grais Helice servanda magistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>; so also Tacitus: nec litore tenus adcrescere aut resorberi, Agr. 10; G. 7 <hi rend="ital">ter;</hi> H. 1, 32; so after <hi rend="ital">non</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non eo dico, quo mihi veniat in dubium tua fides, aut quo etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jure aut legibus cognoscunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 24</bibl>; after <hi rend="ital">haud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haud alias populus plus occultae vocis aut suspicacis silentii permisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; after <hi rend="ital">nihil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil caedis aut praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.18" n="E" level="2"> The poets connect by aut... vel, vel... aut, instead of aut... aut, or vel... vel: Quotiens te votui Argu <pb n="211" /> <cb n="AUTE" /> rippum Conpellare aut contrectare conloquive aut contui? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut appone dapes, Vare, vel aufer opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:78:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 78, 6</bibl></cit> (this epigram is rejected by Schneid.): <cit><quote lang="la">Non ars aut astus belli vel dextera deerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:32" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.19" n="F" level="1"> In connection with other particles. </sense><sense id="n4632.20" n="1" level="3"> Aut etiam, to complete or strengthen an assertion, <hi rend="ital">or also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo aut hunc prohibet, aut etiam Xenocratem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectura in multas aut diversas, aut etiam in contrarias partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 26, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aut ambigue aut inconstanter aut incredibiliter dicta sunt, aut etiam aliter ab alio dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi omnia aut scripta esse a tuis arbitror, aut etiam nuntiis ac rumore perlata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—So with one aut: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de illo acceperant, aut etiam suspicabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:19:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 19, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo sim (orator), aut etiam quicumque sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.21" n="2" level="3"> Aut certe, aut modo, aut quidem, or aut sane, to restrict a declaration, <hi rend="ital">or at least</hi> (cf. II. A.). </sense><sense id="n4632.22" n="a" level="4"> Aut certe: <cit><quote lang="la">ac video hanc primam ingressionem meam aut reprehensionis aliquid, aut certe admirationis habituram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 17, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo enim uno vincebamur a victā Graeciā, id aut ereptum illis est, aut certe nobis cum illis communicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 254</bibl></cit>; so Dolabella ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 46, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:21:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 21, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.23" n="b" level="4"> Aut modo: <cit><quote lang="la">Si umquam posthac aut amasso Casinam, aut obcepso modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.24" n="c" level="4"> Aut quidem: <cit><quote lang="la">Proinde desinant quidam quaerere ultra aut opinari... aut quidem vetustissimā nave impositos jubebo avehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.25" n="d" level="4"> Aut sane: <cit><quote lang="la">Afer aut Sardus sane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.26" n="3" level="3"> Aut vero, to connect a more important thought, <hi rend="ital">or indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or truly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quem tibi aut hominem, aut vero deum, auxilio futurum putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis enim tibi hoc concesserit, aut initio genus hominum se oppidis moenibusque saepsisse? Aut vero etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.27" n="4" level="3"> Aut potius, for correction or greater definiteness, <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi> (cf. II. C.): <cit><quote lang="la">Erravit, aut potius insanivit Apronius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditores aut potius apertos hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est injustus, aut incauti potius habendi sunt improbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae est ergo ista ratio, aut quae potius ista amentia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4632.28" n="5" level="3"> Aut ne... quidem: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam aut rem aut ne spem quidem exspecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>!*? Aut regularly precedes the words of its clause, but sometimes in the poets it takes the second place: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni aut sacram me tenuisse diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">justos aut reperire pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persequar aut studium linguae etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:21:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 21, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fer pater, inquit, opem! Tellus aut hisce, vel istam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 545</bibl></cit> (Merk., <hi rend="ital">ait</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Balteus aut fluxos gemmis adstrinxit amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 362</bibl></cit>, where some read <hi rend="ital">haud.</hi> See more upon this word in Hand, Turs. I. pp. 525-558.</sense></entryFree>
autem: <entryFree id="n4633" type="main" key="autem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autem</orth>, <sense id="n4633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [v. aut <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>], <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nevertheless;</hi> sometimes an emphasized <hi rend="ital">and</hi> (it is never found at the beginning of a clause, but after one or more words; v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; like <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, it joins to a preceding thought a new one, either entirely antithetical or simply different; it differs from the restricting <hi rend="ital">sed</hi> in like manner with <hi rend="ital">at;</hi> v. at <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, and cf.: [Popilius imperator tenebat provinciam; <cit><quote lang="la">in cujus exercitu Catonis filius tiro militabat. Cum autem Popilio videretur unam dimittere legionem, Catonis quoque filium ... dimisit. Sed cum amore pugnandi in exercitu permansisset, Cato ad Popilium scripsit, etc.],</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit> B. and K. (most freq. in philos. lang.; rare in the histt., being used by Caes. only 59 times, by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> 23</bibl>, and by <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 31</bibl>; and very rare in the poets). </sense><sense id="n4633.1" n="I" level="1"> In joining an entirely antithetical thought, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi> = at quidem, at vero, <foreign lang="greek">se\ sh/</foreign>, esp. freq. with the pronouns ego, tu, ille, qui, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ait se obligāsse crus fractum Aesculapio, Apollini autem bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam injusta ab justis impetrari non decet, Justa autem ab injustis petere insipientiast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic cesso, quia ipse nihil scribo: lego autem libentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl>; Plaut. <cb n="AUTE" /> Men. 2, 1, 43: i sane cum illo, Phrygia; <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem, Eleusium, Huc intro abi ad nos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ad enarrandum hoc argumentumst comitas, Si ad auscultandum vostra erit benignitas. Qui autem auscultare nolit, exsurgat foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid tu aïs, Gnatho? Numquid habes quod contemnas?
