Quid tu autem, Thraso?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: e principio oriuntur omnia; <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum autem nullā ex re aliā nasci potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.2" n="II" level="1"> In joining a thought that is simply different. </sense><sense id="n4633.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4633.4" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, as the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">se/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vehit hic clitellas, vehit hic autem alter senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Speusippum, sororis filium, Plato philosophiae quasi heredem reliquisset, duo autem praestantissimos studio atque doctrinā, Xenocratem Chalcedonium et Aristotelem Stagiritem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum consultum, cui relinqueret regnum, voluisse optimum deligi, judicatum autem ab ipso optimum Perdiccam, cui anulum tradidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atque haec in moribus. De benevolentiā autem, quam etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 81</bibl>: Sed poëtae quid quemque deceat ex personā judicabunt; <cit><quote lang="la">nobis autem personam imposuit natura etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 97</bibl></cit>; 1, 28, 98; 1, 43, 152: Quod semper movetur aeternum est; <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem motum adfert alicui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28, 68</bibl> sq.; 1, 30, 74; 1, 36, 87.—So sometimes when one conditional sentence is opposed to another, si—sin autem, in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei) me/n— ei) se/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam si supremus ille dies non exstinctionem, sed commutationem adfert loci, quid optabilius? Sin autem etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49, 118 al.</bibl>—In adducing an example of a rule: <cit><quote lang="la">Et Demosthenes autem ad Aeschinem orationem in prooemio convertit, et M. Tullius etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 66</bibl></cit> Spald.; <cit><quote lang="la">also in passing from a particular to a general thought: Et sane plus habemus quam capimus. Insatiabilis autem avaritia est etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.5" n="b" level="4"> Preceded by <hi rend="ital">quidem</hi>, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/n—se/</foreign> (perh. most freq. in Cicero's philosophical works, under the influence of Greek style): Et haec quidem hoc modo; <cit><quote lang="la">nihil autem melius extremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sed nunc quidem valetudini tribuamus aliquid, cras autem etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; and thus in Tac. several times, but only in Ann. and Or.: bene intellegit ceteros quidem iis niti... Marcellum autem et Crispum attulisse etc., Or. 8; 18 <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> 25; A. 3, 53; 3, 73; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 28.—So often in transitions from one subject to another: Ac de inferendā quidem injuriā satis dictum est. Praetermittendae autem defensionis etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45, 160</bibl>.—So very often in Vulg. in direct reproduction of <foreign lang="greek">me/n—se/</foreign>: Ego quidem baptizo vos in aquā in paenitentiam; qui autem post me etc., Matt. 3, 11; 9, 37; 13, 23; 13, 32; 17, 11 sq.; 23, 28; 25, 33; 26, 24. —</sense><sense id="n4633.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4633.7" n="1" level="3"> In any kind of transition: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Antonius in eo libro, quem unum reliquit, disertos ait se vidisse multos, eloquentem omnino neminem. Vir autem acerrimo ingenio (sic enim fuit) multa etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (pater) prout ipse amabat litteras, omnibus doctrinis, quibus puerilis aetas impertiri debet, filium erudivit: erat autem in puero summa suavitas oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also in questions: Quid autem magno opere Oppianicum metuebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 167</bibl></cit>. Freq. several times repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">Expetuntur autem divitiae cum ad usus vitae necessarios, tum ad perfruendas voluptates: in quibus autem major est animus, in iis pecuniae cupiditas spectat ad opes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit> and 25; cf. Wopkens, Lectt. Tull. pp. 53 and 122: Orbis situm dicere adgredior... Dicam autem alias plura et exactius, Mel. prooem. 2.—</sense><sense id="n4633.8" n="2" level="3"> In repeating a word from a previous clause, in continuing a train of thought: <cit><quote lang="la">admoneri me satis est: admonebit autem nemo alius nisi rei publicae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 94</bibl></cit>: disces quam diu voles; <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu autem velle debebis, quoad etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quod agitur, agamus: agitur autem, liberine vivamus an mortem obeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>. —So esp. in impassioned discourse, Plant. Mil. 3, 1, 84: <cit><quote lang="la">humanum amare est, humanum autem ignoscere est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <cb n="AUTE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot potiones mulsi! quot autem prandia!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā pulchritudine urbem, quibus autem opibus praeditam, servitute oppressam tenuit civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4633.9" n="3" level="3"> Like sed, vero, igitur, etc., in resuming a train of thought interrupted by a parenthesis: <cit><quote lang="la">Omnino illud honestum, quod ex animo excelso magnificoque quaerimus, animi efficitur non corporis viribus: exercendum tamen corpus et ita adficiendum est, ut oboedire consilio rationique possit in exsequendis negotiis et in labore tolerando: honestum autem id, quod exquirimus, totum est positum in animi curā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.10" n="4" level="3"> In introducing a parenthetical clause itself: quae autem nos ut recta aut recte facta dicamus, si placet (illi autem appellant <foreign lang="greek">katorqw/mata</foreign>) omnes numeros virtutis continent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vitium effugere qui volet (omnes autem velle debent) adhibebit etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">In primis foedera ac leges (erant autem eae duodecim tabuiae et quaedam regiae leges) conquiri etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc Quodcumque est (minus est autem quam rhetoris aera) Discipuli custos praemordet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:217" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.11" n="5" level="3"> In enumerations, for the purpose of adding an important circumstance: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus dicendi labor, magna res, magna dignitas, summa autem gratia,</quote> <trans><tr>but</tr>, <tr>and indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis omnes tenduntur insidiae... vel ab eā, quae penitus in omni sensu implicata insidet, imitatrix boni, voluptas, malorum autem mater omnium,</quote> <trans><tr>yea</tr>, <tr>the parent of all evil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docet ratio mathematicorum, luna quantum absit a proxumā Mercurii stellā, multo autem longius a Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.12" n="6" level="3"> In the syllogism, to introduce the minor proposition (the assumptio or propositio minor; cf. atque, IV. 9., and atqui, II. D.), <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but; but now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aut hoc, aut illud: hoc autem non, igitur illud. Itemque: aut hoc, aut illud: non autem hoc: illud igitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si lucet, lucet: lucet autem, lucet igitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si dicis te mentiri verumque dicis, mentiris: dicis autem te mentiri verumque dicis: mentiris igitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.13" n="7" level="3"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">se/</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">sh/</foreign> in adding an emphatic question (freq. in the comic poets), <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4633.14" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quem te autem deum nominem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perii: quid hoc autemst mali?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quī istuc? Quae res te sollicitat autem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae autem divina? Vigere, sapere, invenire, meminisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: Quo modo autem moveri animus ad appetendum potest, si id, quod videtur, non percipitur? <foreign lang="greek">pw=s sh/</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quo modo autem tibi placebit JOVEM LAPIDEM jurare, cum scias etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veni ad Caesarem: quis est autem Caesar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—So in exclamations: <cit><quote lang="la">Quantā delectatione autem adficerer, cum etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.15" n="b" level="4"> In questions implying rebuke, reproach: <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Metuo credere. <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Credere autem? eho, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 70</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Ego non tangam meam? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Tuam autem, furcifer? <hi rend="ital">yours do you say? yours indeed!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4633.16" n="c" level="4"> In a question where a correction is made: Num quis testis Postumum appellavit? testis autem? (<hi rend="ital">witness did I say?</hi>) num accusator? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alio me vocat numerosa gloria tua: alio autem? quasi vero etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:28" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid tandem isti mali in tam tenerā insulā non fecissent? non fecissent autem? imo quid ante adventum meum non fecerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Adimas</hi> etiam Hispanias? Et si inde cessero, in Africam transcendes. Transcendes autem dico? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44, 7</bibl> Weissenb.—</sense><sense id="n4633.17" n="8" level="3"> And in questions sed autem are sometimes both used, especially by the comic poets, <hi rend="ital">but indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but now</hi>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)lla/—se/ ()*alla\ pou= se\ bou/lei kaqezo/menoi a)nagnw=men</foreign>; Plat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 228</bibl> E.): <cit><quote lang="la">Sed autem quid si hanc hinc apstulerit quispiam Sacram urnam Veneris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and separated: Sed quid haec hic autem tam diu ante aedīs stetit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attat Phaedriae Pater venit. Sed quid pertimui autem, belua?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: Sed quid ego haec autem nequiquam ingrata revolvo? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 101</bibl>.—Once ast autem: ast autem tenui <pb n="212" /> <cb n="AUTO" /> quae candent lumine Phatnae, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1170</bibl> P. (IV. 2, p. 555 Orell.).— </sense><sense id="n4633.18" n="9" level="3"> With interjections: <cit><quote lang="la">Heia autem inimicos!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecce autem litigium,</quote> <trans><tr>but lo!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecce autem alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecce autem subitum divortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecce autem aliud minus dubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eccere autem capite nutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccui autem non proditur [revertenti]?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 33, 68</bibl></cit>.!*? In good prose writers autem is usu. placed after the first word of a clause; but if several words, a subst. and prep., the verb esse with the predicate, a word with a negative, etc., together form one idea, then autem stands after the second or third word. But the poets, especially the comic poets, allow themselves greater liberty, and sometimes place this particle, without any necessity in the nature of the clause, in the third, fourth, or fifth place; but autem is never found in good writers at the beginning of a clause or sentence; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 39</bibl>. See more upon this word in Hand, Turs. I. pp. 558-588.</sense></entryFree>
authenta: <entryFree id="n4634" type="greek" key="authenta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">authenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)qe/nths</foreign>, <sense id="n4634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont. Verg. p. 161</bibl> Muncker.</sense></entryFree>
authenticus: <entryFree id="n4635" type="greek" key="authenti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">authentĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)qentiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that comes from the author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authentic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi> (in the jurists and Church fathers; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: verus, germanus): testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>the original will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">authentĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the original writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the original</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
authepsa: <entryFree id="n4636" type="greek" key="authepsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">authepsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)qe/yhs [au)to/s c)/yw</foreign>, a self-cooker], <sense id="n4636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a utensil for cooking</hi> (somewhat like our tea - urns): <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (vasis) est authepsa illa, quam tanto pretio nuper mercatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenteae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
author: <entryFree id="n4637" type="main" key="author"><orth extent="full" lang="la">author</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">authōrĭtas</orth>, etc., v. auctor, auctoritas, etc.</entryFree>
autochthones: <entryFree id="n4638" type="greek" key="autochtho^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autochthŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)to/xqones</foreign>, <sense id="n4638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aborigines</hi>, = indigenae, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
autographus: <entryFree id="n4639" type="greek" key="auto^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)to/grafos</foreign>, <sense id="n4639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">written with one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">autograph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Autographā quādam epistulā Cenavi, ait, mi Tiberi, cum īsdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 87</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏ-grăphum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an autograph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
autololes: <entryFree id="n4640" type="main" key="Auto^lo^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Autŏlŏles</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Getulian people on the west coast of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north and south of Mount Atlas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 31, 36, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 677</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:306" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 337</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
autolycus: <entryFree id="n4641" type="main" key="Auto^ly^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Autŏlycus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)to/lukos</foreign>, <sense id="n4641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Mercury and Chione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Anticlea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and maternal grandfather of Ulysses</hi> (cf. Hom. Od. 11, 85), <hi rend="ital">a very dexterous robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who could transform himself into various shapes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 313</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 59</bibl>.—Hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">a thievish man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Autolyco hospiti aurum credidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
automatarius: <entryFree id="n4642" type="main" key="auto^ma^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏmătārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. automatus</etym>. <sense id="n4642.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an automaton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">automatic;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n4642.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4642.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏ-mătārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of automata</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4642.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏmătārĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. opus), <hi rend="ital">automaton-work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
automatus: <entryFree id="n4643" type="greek" key="auto^ma^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏmătus</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (os, on), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)to/matos</foreign>, <sense id="n4643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">self - moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏmătŏn</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a self-moving machine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an automaton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 54, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">140, 10</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
automedon: <entryFree id="n4644" type="main" key="Auto^me^do_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Autŏmĕdōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)tome/swn</foreign>. <sense id="n4644.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Diores and charioteer of Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 477</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4644.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a charioteer</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
autonoe: <entryFree id="n4645" type="main" key="Auto^no^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Autŏnŏē</orth>, ēs. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)tono/h</foreign>. <sense id="n4645.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Aristœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Actœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:469" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 469</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n4645.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Autŏnŏēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> cr <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Autonoë</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros = Actaeon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 198</bibl></cit>. <cb n="AUXI" /></sense></entryFree>
autopyrus: <entryFree id="n4646" type="greek" key="auto^py_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autŏpȳrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)to/puros</foreign>, <sense id="n4646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coarse bread made of unbolted flour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
autor: <entryFree id="n4647" type="main" key="autor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">autōrĭtas</orth>, etc., v. auctor, etc.</entryFree>
autumnalis: <entryFree id="n4648" type="main" key="autumna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autumnālis, -nesco, -nĭtas, -no, -num</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nus</orth>, v. auctumnalis, etc.</entryFree>
autumo: <entryFree id="n4649" type="main" key="autu^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">autŭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>for aitumo, as a lengthened form of aio; cf. negumo for nego; for the termination -tumo, cf. aes, aestimo, q. v., aeditumus, finitumus, and maritumus</etym>. <sense id="n4649.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to say aye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affirm</hi> (mostly of questionable assertions, Ellis ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 2</bibl>; opp. nego, to say nay); hence, <hi rend="ital">to assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi> (chiefly anteclass.; esp. freq. in Plaut.; syn.: dico, affirmo, confirmo; <cit><quote lang="la">used only once by Ter. and Hor., and never by Cic., Lucr., or Verg.): Ipsus sese ut neget esse eum qui siet, Meque ut esse autumet qui ipsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: factum id esse hic non negat... et deinde facturum autumat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 19</bibl>: flexa non falsa autumare dictio Delphis solet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 237, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Lucil. ib.: aut hic est aut hic affore actutum autumo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (res) si autumem omnis, nimis longus sermost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 2</bibl>; 5, 2, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 15</bibl>: te esse Tiburtem autumant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Elissā Tyriā, quam quidam Dido autumant, Carthago conditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit> Halm.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi salsa muriatica esse autumantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4649.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, effect for cause, <hi rend="ital">to think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>: bene quam meritam esse autumas, Dicis male mereri, auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:13:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 13, 55</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 265 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
auvona: <entryFree id="n4650" type="main" key="Auvo^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auvŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Avon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31</bibl>; cf. Mann. Brit. p. 179.</sense></entryFree>
auxiliabundus: <entryFree id="n4651" type="hapax" key="auxi^li^a_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auxilior</etym>, <sense id="n4651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclined to give help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helping</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 48, 10</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
auxiliaris: <entryFree id="n4652" type="main" key="auxi^li^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭāris</orth> (AVXSILIARIS, Inscr. Momm. 5778), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auxilium</etym>. <sense id="n4652.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bringing help</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assisting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliarius, opem ferens): undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dea (sc. Lucina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:699" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>a formula of incantation in aid of Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 138</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28,2,4, § 21</bibl>: arma (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> periphrastically for the prose auxilia; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">auxiliaries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> M.6,424</bibl>: aera, <hi rend="ital">the cymbals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kettles</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">by rattling which the ancients believed that they were able to drive away an eclipse of the moon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:333" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 333</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum auxiliare lethargicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:82 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 82 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliaria fulmina, quae advocata seu advocantium bono veniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: auxiliares milites, cohortes, etc.; or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭāres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliaries</hi> (freq. opp. legiones): auxiliares dicuntur in bello socii Romanorum exterarum nationum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34, 5</bibl>; Tac Agr. 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl>; and <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Gannascus) auxiliaris et diu meritus Gallorum oram vastabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl></cit> Halm.—</sense><sense id="n4652.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to auxiliaries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliaria stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auxiliarius: <entryFree id="n4653" type="main" key="auxi^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭārĭus</orth> (AVXSILIARIVS, Corp. Inscr. III. 4753), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary</hi> (less freq. than the preceding): <cit><quote lang="la">magis consiliarius amicus quam auxiliarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—In milit. lang., </sense><sense id="n4653.1" n="A" level="2"> With milites, equites, cohors, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliaries</hi> (opp. legiones): miles, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87, 1</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4653.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">assumpsit sibi auxiliarios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes auxiliarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Macc. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auxiliatio: <entryFree id="n4654" type="hapax" key="auxi^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>auxilior</etym>, <sense id="n4654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aiding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 403</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
auxiliator: <entryFree id="n4655" type="main" key="auxi^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">litigantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud inglorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegris auxiliator adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliator tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 33, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:30:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 30, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
auxiliatrix: <entryFree id="n4656" type="main" key="auxi^li^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>auxiliator</etym>, <sense id="n4656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she</hi> <cb n="AUXI" /> <hi rend="ital">that helps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which aids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: sapientia, Mythogr. Vat. 2, 113 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
auxiliatus: <entryFree id="n4657" type="hapax" key="auxi^li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>auxilior</etym>, <sense id="n4657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alituum genus videmus a pinnis tremulum petere auxiliatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1040" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1040</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auxilio: <entryFree id="n4658" type="main" key="auxi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭo</orth>, v. auxilior <sense id="n4658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auxilior: <entryFree id="n4659" type="main" key="auxi^li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>auxilium</etym>, <sense id="n4659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give help</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (syn.: juvo, adjuvo, opitulor, subvenio, succurro). </sense><sense id="n4659.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class. but rare; in Cic. perh. only once in his Epistt.), constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne id flagitiumst te aliis consilium dare, tibi non potis esse auxiliarier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:88:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 88, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 2, 18</bibl>: nihil Numantinis vires corporis auxiliatae sunt, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4659.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of the aid of a physician, <hi rend="ital">to aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec (medicina) formidatis auxiliatur aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferulam quibusdam morbis auxiliari dicunt medici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalangites auxiliantur contra scorpionum ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 98, § 124</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n4659.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to give aid</hi>, etc.: alicui, Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 395</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n4659.4" n="b" level="4"> Auxilior in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">a me auxiliatus, Lucil. ap. Prisc. pp. 791 and 927 P.: consonantes sunt in quibus (vox) ab imis auxiliata egrediatur ad aures disertā verborum claritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auxilium: <entryFree id="n4660" type="main" key="auxi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>augeo</etym>, <sense id="n4660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (syn.: adjumentum, opes, praesidium, subsidium). </sense><sense id="n4660.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Fer mi auxilium, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl>: quo praesidio fretus, auxiliis quibus? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 262, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium argentarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1,1, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habeo ad auxilium copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navita indigus omni vitali auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerunt ad auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:10:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 10, 3 al.</bibl>—Hence the phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium esse alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to assist one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; and more freq.: auxilio esse alicui, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 111, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 90 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium ferre alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring assistance</tr>, <tr>to aid</tr>, <tr>succor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1064</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(contra aliquem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 580</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 693</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 20, 14</bibl>; ib. Job, 30, 13 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">once adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 691</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:59:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 59, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">107, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Par. 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium sibi adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 19 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde auxilium petam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 41, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 507</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 461</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Esdr. 8, 22; ib. Judith, 6, 21 et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (mare) tumet, auxiliis adsidet ille (navita) suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia portare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">magna duo auxilia,</quote> <trans><tr>sources of aid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne auxilia liberorum innocentibus deessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. for concr.), <hi rend="ital">a place of succor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sex (oppida) erunt in fugitivorum auxilia separata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 35, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4660.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4660.3" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang. very freq., and commonly in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">auxĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliaries</hi> (mostly composed of allies and light-armed troops; <cit><quote lang="la">hence opp. to the legions): auxilium appellatum ab auctu, cum accesserant ei qui adjumento essent alienigenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L L. 5:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L L. 5, § 90</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliares, and Smith, Dict. Antiq.: quibus (copiis) rex Deiotarus imperatoribus nostris auxilia mitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 8, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliis in mediam aciem conjectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab sociis et nomine Latino accersere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 84:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 8, 15</bibl> et saep.—Opp to the legions: <cit><quote lang="la">sex legiones et magna equitum ac peditum auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oroden auctus auxilio Pharasmanes vocare ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 387</bibl>.—Borrowed from miht. lang.: Duodecim deis plus quam in caelo <pb n="213" /> <cb n="AVAR" /> deorumst inmortalium Mihi nunc auxilio adjutores sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 10 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auxilia ac socios jam pacto foedere habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1443</bibl></cit>.—In gen.: auxilia, <hi rend="ital">military force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar confisus famā rerum gestarum, infirmis auxiliis proficisci non dubitaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4660.4" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">an antidote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi>, in the most extended sense of the word: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26</bibl>, n. 21 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversae valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4660.5" n="C" level="2"> Auxilium as a personified existence, like Fides. Salus, etc., in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auxilla: <entryFree id="n4661" type="gloss" key="auxilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxilla</orth>: olla parvula, <sense id="n4661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pot</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=24" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 24</bibl> Müll.; cf. olla.</sense></entryFree>
auxim: <entryFree id="n4662" type="main" key="auxim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auxim</orth>, <itype>is, it</itype>, etc., v. augeo <sense id="n4662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auximum: <entryFree id="n4663" type="main" key="Auxi^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auxĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Piceni</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Osimo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3868</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3899</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Auxĭ-mātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Auximum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 489 sq.</sense></entryFree>
auxo: <entryFree id="n4664" type="main" key="Auxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auxo</orth>, <itype>ōnis or ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)cw/</foreign>, <sense id="n4664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Hours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Jupiter and Themis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auzea: <entryFree id="n4665" type="main" key="Auze_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auzēa</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Auzīa</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Audīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in</hi> Mauretania Caesariensis, afterwards a Roman colony: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum semirutum, cui nomen Auzea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit> Halm; Itin. Ant.</sense></entryFree>
ava: <entryFree id="n4666" type="main" key="ava"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ava</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. avia.</entryFree>
avare: <entryFree id="n4667" type="main" key="a^va_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. avarus <sense id="n4667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
avaricum: <entryFree id="n4668" type="main" key="Ava_ri^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Avārĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large and fortified town of the Bituriges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bourges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Dép. du Cher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 47</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Avārĭcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Avaricum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
avariter: <entryFree id="n4669" type="main" key="a^va_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. avarus <sense id="n4669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
avaritia: <entryFree id="n4670" type="main" key="a^va_ri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>avarus</etym>, <sense id="n4670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a greedy desire</hi> for possessions, <hi rend="ital">greediness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avarice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covetousness</hi> (opp. abstinentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">periphrastically, pecuniae cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>; syn.: aviditas, cupido). </sense><sense id="n4670.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Est autem avaritia opinatio vehemens de pecuniā, quasi valde expetenda sit, inhaerens et penitus insita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: avaritia est injuriosa appetitio alienorum, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam si tollere voltis, mater ejus est tollenda luxuries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia hians et imminens,</quote> <trans><tr>a gaping and eager avarice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueris talorum nucumque avaritia est: viris auri argentique et urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae (sc. nimiae parsimoniae) singulos increpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes avaritiae,</quote> <trans><tr>every kind of selfishness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4670.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">eagerness</hi> for food, <hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quam siquis avidus poscit escam avariter, Decipitur in transennā avaritia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: avaritia gloriae, <hi rend="ital">eager desire for renown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
avarities: <entryFree id="n4671" type="main" key="a^va_ri^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for avaritia, <sense id="n4671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">avarice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarities et honorum caeca cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>; and besides perh. only <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 185</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 372.</sense></entryFree>
avarus: <entryFree id="n4672" type="main" key="a^va_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n4672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. fem.</hi> avarūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 9</bibl> dub.; Speng., <hi rend="ital">aurum</hi>) [1. aveo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:5:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 5, 13</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">eagerly desirous</hi> of something, esp. of possessions, <hi rend="ital">avaricious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covetous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy</hi> (opp. largus, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 510, 20</bibl>: avarum et avidum ita discernuntur: avarum semper in reprehensione est; <cit><quote lang="la">avidum autem malis aliquando, aliquando bonis adjungitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 442, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>; v. II.; syn.: avidus, cupidus, tenax, sordidus). </sense><sense id="n4672.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:110:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 110, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carmine formosae, pretio capiuntur avarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarus et furax homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper avarus eget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum discordet parcus avaro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 194</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 606</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. to inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">fuge litus avarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl></cit> ( = avarorum, Serv.): <cit><quote lang="la">Troja, i. e. with reference to the perjured avarice of Laomedon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 208</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perjura Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 811</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 215</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: Acheron. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 492</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:26:10 al" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 26, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4672.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the poets sometimes without the access. idea of reproach: <cb n="AVEN" /> Graiis praeter laudem nullius avaris, <hi rend="ital">eager only for glory</hi>, Hor.A.P.324: <cit><quote lang="la">agricola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avariores magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruberes, Viveret in terris te si quis avarior uno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 157</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo avarissime et spurcissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covetously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avariciously</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n4672.3" n="a" level="4"> Ante-class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārĭter</orth>, Cato and Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 510, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingurgitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>. —Of gluttony: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis avidus poscit escam avariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. avaritia, II.—</sense><sense id="n4672.4" n="b" level="4"> Class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvārē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">avare pretium statui arti meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbe avareque imperitare victis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more greedily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarius exigere opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarissime horas suas servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aveho: <entryFree id="n4673" type="main" key="a_ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-vĕho</orth> (in MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">abvĕho</orth>; v. ab <sense id="n4673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>vexi, vectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (avexti = avexisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 24</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear off</hi> (of chariots, ships, horses, etc.; v. veho; class., but perh. not in Cic.; syn. aufero): <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Rogas? Quine eam hinc avexti? <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Non avexi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Samo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in finitimas urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alias terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:188" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 188</bibl></cit>.—With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitusque alias avexerat oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 512</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Aegyptum avexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 43, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be carried away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avectus (sc. equo) ab suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditis avectos hostes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 43 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
avella: <entryFree id="n4674" type="main" key="A^vella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăvella</orth>, v. Abella.</entryFree>
avellanus: <entryFree id="n4675" type="main" key="A^vella_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăvellānus</orth>, v. Abella.</entryFree>
avello: <entryFree id="n4676" type="main" key="a_vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-vello</orth>, <itype>velli or vulsi, vulsum or volsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n4676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> avellerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> avulsi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 764</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to tear off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rend off</hi> (syn.: abripio, eximo). </sense><sense id="n4676.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">avellere tigna trabesque,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear away planks and beams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avolsaque saxa Montibus,</quote> <trans><tr>the rocks rent from the mountains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avolsum umeris caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 558</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 727</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 358</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avolsos silices a montibus altis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avolsus radicibus oculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 563</bibl></cit>: poma ex arboribus, si cruda sunt, vix avelluntur; <cit><quote lang="la">si matura et cocta, decidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum ripa simul avolsos ferat Aufidus acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Avellit frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summitatem frondium ejus avulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:17:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 17, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ex eā avolsa postea Therasia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euboea avolsa Boeotiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4676.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4676.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away by force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatale sacrato avellere templo Palladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2,
