165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum emptori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:7:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:3" default="NO">40, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avellamus eum ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of carrying off the bride,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 21</bibl></cit> Ellis.—</sense><sense id="n4676.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To separate from something by pulling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de matris complexu avellere atque abstrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab uberibus avellere,</quote> <trans><tr>to wean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sperem posse (eum) avelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non potes avelli! simul, ah, simul ibimus, inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complexu avolsus Iuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut avellerentur castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to tear one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 39</bibl>.— And in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> without the notion of violence, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et ipse avulsus est ab eis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 41</bibl></cit> Tisch.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a tanto errore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
avena: <entryFree id="n4677" type="main" key="a^ve_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. 1. aveo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; orig. nourishment</etym>. <sense id="n4677.0" n="I.A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Oats;</hi> and specif., <hi rend="ital">common oats</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bro/mos</foreign>: Avena sativa, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4677.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barren oats</hi>, a weed, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ai)gi/lwy</foreign>: Avena fatua, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4677.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4677.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stalk of grass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a straw</hi>, etc.: (linum) tam gracili avenā. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:168" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 18, 103, § 168</bibl>.—Used for a shepherd's pipe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 192</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4677.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reed-pipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvestrem tenui Musam meditaris avenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucenti cantus meditabar avenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:71" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est modulatus avenā Carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: pastor junctis pice cantat avenis, Ov. <cb n="AVEO" /> Tr. 5, 10, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">et structis cantat avenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:M. 1:677" default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Angustā cantare licet videaris avenā, Dum tua multorum vincat avena tubas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
avenaceus: <entryFree id="n4678" type="main" key="a^ve_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvēnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>avena</etym>, <sense id="n4678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <trans><tr>oatmeal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 67, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:75" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8, 22, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
avenarius: <entryFree id="n4679" type="hapax" key="a^ve_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to oats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
avenio: <entryFree id="n4680" type="main" key="Ave^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Avĕnĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Avennĭo</orth>, Tab. Peut., and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Avĕnĭon</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)eniw(n</foreign>, <sense id="n4680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Avignon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. p. 94.</sense></entryFree>
avens: <entryFree id="n4681" type="main" key="a^vens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. 1. aveo, II.</entryFree>
aventer: <entryFree id="n4682" type="main" key="a^venter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăventer</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. aveo, <sense id="n4682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aventinus: <entryFree id="n4683" type="main" key="A^venti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăventīnus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">i</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n4683.0" n="I.A." level="1"> (Sc. mons.) <hi rend="ital">The Aventine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven hills of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending from the Palatine to the Cœlian Mount;</hi> until the reign of Ancus Marcius, without the city proper, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 4</bibl>. The origin of the name is uncertain; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl>, it was named from Aventinus, an Alban king buried there; other etymologies are given by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 43</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 657</bibl>, where, beside the etymologies given and referred to, another is given from Varro; cf. Creuz, Antiq. p. 23 sq.; Smith, Dict. Antiq.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aventī-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 1</bibl> and 5; 21, 62, 8.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n4683.1" n="B" level="2"> The <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n4683.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăventīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Mount Aventine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 4, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:884" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 884</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:728" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 82</bibl></cit>: Remus, because he consulted the auspices there (therefore its summit was called Remuria; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Remurinus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:50" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana, because she had there an ancient and very distinguished temple,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:69" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:73:1" default="NO">7, 73, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4683.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăven-tīnensis</orth> (Fest. s. v. nesi, p. 165 Müll.) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăventīnĭensis</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 1</bibl>), e, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Aventine</hi>: Diana, who had a temple upon the Aventine Hill —</sense><sense id="n4683.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 657</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aveo: <entryFree id="n4684" type="main" key="a^ve^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from Sanscr. av, to love, to wish; to satisfy one's self, to be content, to do or fare well</etym>, <sense id="n4684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crave</hi> (syn.: volo, cupio): avere nihil aliud est quam cupere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 14</bibl> Müll.: ab ludis animus atque aures avent Avide exspectantes nuntium, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 70</bibl> (Trag. v. 70 Vahl.).—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <case>acc.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4684.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te imitari aveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illud in his quoque te rebus cognoscere avemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedere aventes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non est mihi tempus aventi Ponere signa novis praeceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propiusque accedere aventi figere pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde aveo scire quid agas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jam mens praetrepidans avet vagari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avet (ara) spargier agno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum L. Paulum omnium oculi conspicere urbem curru ingredientem avent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 32, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avebat animus antire statimque memorare exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4684.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia semper aves quod abest, praesentia temnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 957</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1082</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1083" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1083</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parto, quod avebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aveo genus legationis ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (acc. to conj. of Gronov.; so B. and K.; v. Orell. ad h. l.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:371" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 371</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4684.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et mora, quae fluvios passim refrenat aventes,</quote> <trans><tr>which restrains the eager river</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 531</bibl></cit>, where Lachm. and Munro read <hi rend="ital">euntīs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Talem dira sibi scelerisque dolique ministram Quaerit avens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4684.4" n="II" level="1"> Avens = libens, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">ăventer</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi> (post - class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5</bibl> and 19.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4685" type="main" key="a^ve^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĕo</orth> (or, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hă-vĕo</orth>; cf. Spald. ad l. l. and Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Gr. 1, p. 185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. 1, p. 185</bibl>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>v. 1. aveo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n4685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fare well;</hi> except once in Mamert., used only in the <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> ave, aveto, avete, and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> avere, as a form of salutation, both at meeting and separating, like salve and <foreign lang="greek">xai=re</foreign> (hence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 13</bibl> explains it by gaudeo). </sense><sense id="n4685.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">Hail! God bless thee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farewell! adieu</hi> (prob. not used by Cic.): Caesar simulatque, Have, mihi dixit, statim exposuit,<pb n="214" /> <cb n="AVER" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">had saluted me</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam dicis Ave, sed reddis etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:95:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 95, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ave! gratiā plena, Dominus tecum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jesus occurrit illis dicens Avete!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 28, 9</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In mock homage (eccl. Lat.): dixit Ave! Rabbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 15, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 19, 3</bibl>.—Haveto at the end of a letter, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 6</bibl>; and Ave at the beginning, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcus avere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:5:10 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 5, 10 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n4685.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4685.3" n="A" level="2"> As a morning greeting (diff. from vale, a greeting at separating in the evening; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut liberti servique mane salvere, vesperi valere sibi singuli dicerent): et matutinum portat ineptus ave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:109" default="NO">1, 56, 109</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 4, 79, 4; 7, 39, 2.—</sense><sense id="n4685.4" n="B" level="2"> As a farewell to the dead, = vale: Atque in perpetuom, frater, ave atque vale, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 101, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so frequently in inscriptions,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2663</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4732</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4734</bibl>; 4735; <cit><quote lang="la">4742. But in Martial avere is distinguished, as a greeting to the living, from valere, a greeting to the dead: Jam satis est, Afer: non vis avere: vale!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>. And thus the ambiguity of avere in the anecdote in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl> is to be explained: Emissurus (Claudius) Fucinum lacum naumachiam ante commisit. Sed cum proclamantibus naumachiariis, Ave (<hi rend="ital">farewell</hi>), Imperator, morituri te salutant: respondisset, Avete vos (i. e. <hi rend="ital">as dying</hi>), neque post hanc vocem, quasi venia data (since they interpreted the exclamation as <hi rend="ital">live!</hi>), quisquam dimicare vellet, etc.—</sense><sense id="n4685.5" n="C" level="2"> As a mere expression of goodwill (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec Ave ei dixeritis,</quote> <trans><tr>nor bid him God-speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,024:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Joan. 10, 11</bibl></cit>.!*? As <hi rend="ital">finite verb</hi>: aveo plane Imperator et avebo... cum is avere jubeat, qui jam fecit, ut averem, Mamert. Grat. Act. ad Julian.</sense></entryFree>
avernalis: <entryFree id="n4686" type="main" key="A^verna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăvernālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Avernus</etym>, <sense id="n4686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Lake Avernus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:26" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naiades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sibylla,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dwelling by the lake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:49" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
avernus: <entryFree id="n4687" type="greek" key="A^vernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăvernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/ornos</foreign>. <sense id="n4687.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without birds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>where no birds can live</tr>, <tr>on account of the pestiferous exhalations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:738 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 738 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:818" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 818</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <trans><tr>the vapor of Avernus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 830</bibl></cit>.—But esp. Avernus lacus or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Avernus, <hi rend="ital">Lake Avernus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cumœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Puteoli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Baiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost entirely enclosed by steep and wooded hills</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Lago Averno</hi>), <hi rend="ital">whose deadly exhalations killed the birds flying over it;</hi> therefore the myth placed near it the entrance to the lower world, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 746</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:201 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 201 al.</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 718 sq.; Heyne, Excurs. II. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6</bibl>.—The renowned Cumæan Sibyl also dwelt in a grotto near it.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lower world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 636</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:46 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 46 al.</bibl>—Also = Acheron: <cit><quote lang="la">pigri sulcator Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:588" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 588</bibl></cit>.—Personified as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 164</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4687.1" n="II" level="1"> Another <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăvernus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n4687.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to Lake Avernus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 564</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <trans><tr>Lake Avernus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 164</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăverna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 442</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4687.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:76" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Proserpina</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 601</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno inferna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 138</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
averro: <entryFree id="n4688" type="hapax" key="a_verro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-verro</orth>, <itype>verri, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brush off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, Licin. Macer. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 900</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
averrunco: <entryFree id="n4689" type="main" key="a_verrunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-verrunco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, a very ancient word, peculiar to the lang. of religion, <sense id="n4689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to avert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti calamitates intemperiasque prohibessis, defendas averruncesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl></cit>: di averruncent, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl>, A.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (prodigiorum) averruncandorum causā supplicationes senatus decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec procul a nobis averruncetur amentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 18</bibl></cit>.—So in the old Optat. form averruncassint = averruncent, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=102" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 102</bibl> Müll.; in Paul. ex Fest. s. v. verruncent, p. 373 Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 90 Rib.; by <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 74, 23</bibl>, erroneously ascribed to Lucilius); and in the very ancient <hi rend="ital">inf. fut.</hi>: possum ego istam capite cladem averruncassere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 74, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 106 Rib.). <cb n="AVER" /></sense></entryFree>
averruncus: <entryFree id="n4690" type="main" key="A_verruncus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āverruncus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>averrunco</etym>, <sense id="n4690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an averting deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertendo Averruncare, ut deus, qui eis rebus praeest, Averruncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=102" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 102</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">In istis diis, quos placari oportet, uti mala a nobis vel a frugibus natis amoliantur, Av[er]uncus quoque habetur Robigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 14</bibl></cit> Hertz.</sense></entryFree>
aversabilis: <entryFree id="n4691" type="main" key="a_versa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aversor</etym>, <sense id="n4691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that before which one is obliged to turn away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aversatio: <entryFree id="n4692" type="main" key="a_versa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tacita aversatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienorum processuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
aversatrix: <entryFree id="n4693" type="hapax" key="a_versa_tri_x"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversātrīx</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that turns away from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aversim: <entryFree id="n4694" type="hapax" key="a_versi_m"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversīm</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>averto</etym>, <sense id="n4694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">avertedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sidewise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineae aversim positae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 25</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
aversio: <entryFree id="n4695" type="main" key="a_versi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n4695.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">a turning away;</hi> only in the adverb. phrases, </sense><sense id="n4695.1" n="A" level="2"> Ex aversione, <hi rend="ital">from behind</hi>: illi de praesidio insecuti ex aversione legatos jugulārunt, Auct. B. Hisp. 22 Moeb.—</sense><sense id="n4695.2" n="B" level="2"> In the Latin of the jurists: per aversionem or aversione emere, vendere, locare, etc., <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sell</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a turning away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned away</hi>, i. e. without accurate reckoning, <hi rend="ital">in the gross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the lot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:62" default="NO">18, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:10" default="NO">14, 2, 10</bibl>; 19, 2, 36; 14, 1, 1 al.—</sense><sense id="n4695.3" n="II. A." level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a turning away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a figure by which the orator turns the attention of his hearers from the theme before them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of apostrophe</hi> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 425</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 39</bibl>; Aquil. Rom. 9, p. 102 Ruhnk. Frotsch.—</sense><sense id="n4695.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non metu mortis se patriam deserere, sed Deorum coactum aversione, Dictys, Bell. Troj. 4, 18: aversione stomachorum di laborant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 231</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aversor: <entryFree id="n4696" type="main" key="a_versor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n4696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to turn one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn away</hi> (from displeasure, contempt, loathing, shame, etc.). </sense><sense id="n4696.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: nulla vis tormentorum acerrimorum praetermittitur; <cit><quote lang="la">aversari advocati et jam vix ferre posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere homo, aversari, rubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4696.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: aliquem or aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to turn away a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing from one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium (consul) aversatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not permitting his presence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 14</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictum non aversatus amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes Syracusanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversatur [dicentem],</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">petentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 672</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 478</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 394 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effeminatas artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46, 4</bibl></cit> Schwarz; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">latum clavum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: aversati sunt proelium facere, <hi rend="ital">declined</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 14.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu notare aversato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 28" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4697" type="hapax" key="a_versor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilferer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embezzler</hi> (cf. averto, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aversus: <entryFree id="n4698" type="main" key="a_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from averto.</entryFree>
averta: <entryFree id="n4699" type="greek" key="a_verta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āverta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)orth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a portmanteau</hi> or <hi rend="ital">saddle-bags</hi> (in pure Lat., mantica; cf. Acron. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> p. 1, 6, 106</bibl>), Cod. Th. 8, 5, 47; Imp. Leo Cod. 12, 51 al.</sense></entryFree>
avertarius: <entryFree id="n4700" type="hapax" key="a_verta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āvertārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>averta</etym> (sc. equus), <sense id="n4700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a horse that bears the averta</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 22, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
averto: <entryFree id="n4701" type="main" key="a_verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-verto</orth> (arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>; in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">abverto</orth>; cf. ab <sense id="n4701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> something <hi rend="ital">away from a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, etc. (opp. adverto). </sense><sense id="n4701.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4701.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4701.3" n="a" level="4"> Constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem ab</hi> or with the simple <case>abl.</case>; the limit designated by <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi> (more rarely by <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ab saxo avortit fluctus ad litus scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Jup.</hi> Te volo, uxor, conloqui. Quor ted avortisti? <hi rend="ital">Alc.</hi> Est ita ingenium meum: <cit><quote lang="la">Inimicos semper osa sum optuerier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(M. Lepidus) Antonio diadema Caesari imponente se avertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos flumina arcemus, dirigimus, avertimus,</quote> <trans><tr>turn off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11, 3</bibl>: quod iter ab Arari Helvetii averterant,<cb n="AVER" />  <hi rend="ital">had turned aside their march from</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">locis seminis ic tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiā Teucrorum regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a ceteris omnium in se oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in comitiorum disceptationem ab lege certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hominibus ad deos preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: se alicui, instead of ab aliquo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 10</bibl>.—And <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo regnum Italiae Libycas averteret oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 106</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod mihi non patrii poterant avertere amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:24:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 24, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:491" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 491</bibl>.—Also without an antecedent <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> (since this is included in the verb) with <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fugam classem, Liv 22, 19, 11: dissipatos in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:34:15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 34, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; hence <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille acies avertit avertetque (sc. in fugam),</quote> <trans><tr>put to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:9:19:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 19, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4701.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. signif. with the <case>acc.</case>, in the Greek manner, <hi rend="ital">to turn away from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus fontes avertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 499</bibl></cit> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)postre/fesqai to\ u(/dwr</foreign>, and aversari): <cit><quote lang="la">oppositas impasta avertitur herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:192" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124, 248</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4701.5" n="c" level="4"> As <pos>v. n.</pos> avertere = se avertere, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> one's self <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eam causam huc abs te avorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce avortit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit et avertens roseā cervice refulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum prora avertit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertit et ire in Capitolium coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:4 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4701.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embezzle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compertum publicam pecuniam avertisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid domum tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam omnem domum avertebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellexistis innumerabilem frumenti numerum per triennium aversum a re publicā esse ereptumque aratoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auratam Colchis pellem,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor a stabulis tauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertere praedas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carā pisces avertere mensā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4701.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4701.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divert</hi> a person <hi rend="ital">from</hi> a course of action, purpose, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">accusandi terrores et minae populi opinionem a spe adipiscendi avertunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertant animos a spe recuperandae arcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mentem optimi viri a defensione meae salutis averterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nec vobis averteretur a certamine animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a pietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab incepto avertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a philosophiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4701.9" n="B" level="2"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to turn away from one in feeling</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make averse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disinclined to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to alienate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estrange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones abducis a Bruto. Quas? nempe eas, quas ille a C. Antonii scelere avertit et ad rem publicam suā auctoritate traduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Pompeius totum se ab ejus (sc. Caesaris) amicitiā averterat,</quote> <trans><tr>had quite alienated himself from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates ab alicujus amicitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularium animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 111:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 111, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurum, uti totius Galliae animi a se averterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis mentem deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 406</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">āver-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4701.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Turned off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: aversum hostem videre nemo potuit, <hi rend="ital">turned away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">turned in flight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl>; hence, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi> ( = a tergo; opp. adversus), <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et adversus et aversus impudicus es,</quote> <trans><tr>before and behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canities homini semper a priori parte capitis, tum deinde ab aversā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:272" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 52, 113, § 272</bibl>: ne aversos nostros aggrederentur, <hi rend="ital">fall upon our troops in the rear</hi>, Galba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aversi ab hoste circumvenirentur,</quote> <trans><tr>from behind</tr>, <tr>in the rear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversos proterere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: aversi vulnerantur, Auct. B. Alex. 30; <cit><quote lang="la">32: aversum ferro transfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversos boves caudis in speluncam traxit,</quote> <trans><tr>backwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:9:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aversos caudā traxit in antra boves): aversa hosti porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit in aversā Picens epigrammata chartā,</quote> <trans><tr>upon the back of the paper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 62</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 6</bibl>: liber scriptus in tergo), and so al.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites aversi a proelio,</quote> <trans><tr>withdrawn from the battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">āversum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the hinder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">back part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the back</hi> (as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> only in the <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">per aversa castrorum receptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">per aversa urbis fugam dederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: ad aversa insulae, id. <pb n="215" /> <cb n="AVID" /> 37, 27, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">aversa montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>: aversa Indiae, <hi rend="ital">the back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remoter parts of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl>.—So in adverb. phrase: in aversum, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cetera animalia in aversum posterioribus pedibus quam prioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 248</bibl></cit> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">in diversum</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">collum circum agit (lynx) in aversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 256</bibl></cit> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">in aversum se;</hi> Sillig, <hi rend="ital">in adversum</hi>). —</sense><sense id="n4701.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Disinclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alienated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">averse;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4701.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> (so most frequently in Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">aversus a Musis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversus a vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidi animorum motus, aversi a ratione, et inimicissimi mentis vitaeque tranquillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus aversissimo a me animo fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversissimus ab istis prodigiis sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 50" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4701.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversus mercaturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus aversus contubernio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensioni aversior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 11</bibl></cit> (but acc. to the MSS., <hi rend="ital">adversior</hi> seems here to deserve the preference; so Halm; cf. Spald. and Zumpt ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n4701.14" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversa deae mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversa voluntas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversos soliti componere amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 80</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus aversior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversi animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not used.</sense></entryFree>
avia: <entryFree id="n4702" type="main" key="a^vi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭa</orth>, or in late Lat., <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>avus</etym>, <sense id="n4702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grandmother on the father</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s or the mother</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Matres duas habet et avias duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus avia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avia tam paterna quam materna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: Inter avam et neptem tu mediata agas, Ven. Fort. 8, Carm. 18, 8.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a prejudice</hi>, as it were, inherited from a grandmother: <cit><quote lang="la">dum veteres avias tibi de pulmone revello,</quote> <trans><tr>old wives' fables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:92" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 92</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Gildersleeve.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4703" type="main" key="a^vi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, = senecio or erigeron, <hi rend="ital">groundsel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:6" default="NO">6, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 4, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 4</bibl>; cf. Schneid. ad h. ll.</sense></entryFree>
aviarius: <entryFree id="n4704" type="main" key="a^vi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>avis</etym>. <sense id="n4704.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bird-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rete,</quote> <trans><tr>bird-net</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4704.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> (like apiarius, etc.). </sense><sense id="n4704.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bird-keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO">8, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:12 al" default="NO">8, 11, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4704.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place where birds are kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an aviary</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o)rniqw/n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:4:3" default="NO">3, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:5:5" default="NO">3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 72, § 141</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the abode of wild birds in the forest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sanguineisque inculta rubent aviaria bacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 430</bibl></cit> ( = secreta nemorum, quae aves frequentant, Serv.).</sense></entryFree>
avicella: <entryFree id="n4705" type="main" key="a^vi^cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭcella</orth>, v. aucella.</entryFree>
avicula: <entryFree id="n4706" type="main" key="a^vi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>avis</etym>, <sense id="n4706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviculae nidulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canorae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
avicularius: <entryFree id="n4707" type="hapax" key="a^vi^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>avicula</etym>, = aviarius, <sense id="n4707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird-keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
avide: <entryFree id="n4708" type="main" key="a^vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. avidus <sense id="n4708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aviditas: <entryFree id="n4709" type="main" key="a^vi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>avidus</etym>, <sense id="n4709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eagerness for</hi> something (either lawful or unlawful), <hi rend="ital">avidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement desire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4709.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo senectuti magnam gratiam, quae mihi sermonis aviditatem auxit, potionis et cibi sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviditas legendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere verbum cum omni aviditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapiendi per occasionem triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 65, § 173</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiolarum aviditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 6, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4709.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4709.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Eagerness</hi> for money, <hi rend="ital">covetousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avarice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inhaeret etiam aviditas, desidia, injuria, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(justitia) eas res spernit et neglegit, ad quas plerique inflammati aviditate rapiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque incredibile est, et Roscium quicquam per aviditatem appetīsse et Fannium quicquam per bonitatem amisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 21</bibl></cit> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">avaritiam</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n4709.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Eagerness</hi> in eating, <hi rend="ital">appetite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca in cibis aviditatem incitat inhibetque eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aviditatem excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 37, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aviditer: <entryFree id="n4710" type="main" key="a^vi^di^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭdĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. avidus <sense id="n4710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
avidus: <entryFree id="n4711" type="main" key="a^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. aveo</etym>, <sense id="n4711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">longing eagerly for</hi> something (either lawful or unlawful),<cb n="AVIS" />  <hi rend="ital">desirous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy</hi> (diff. from avarus, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n4711.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4711.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani semper appetentes gloriae praeter ceteras gentes atque avidi laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinatio victoriae avida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">potentiae, honoris, divitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidissimus privatae gratiae, id. H. Fr. (Orat. Cottae ad Popul. p. 245 Gerl.): turba avida novarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidus poenae (sc. sumendae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 172</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli gerundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 3</bibl></cit>: malefaciundi, id. H. Fr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 343</bibl> (p. 251, n. 116 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">avidior properandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. Fr. 4, 30</bibl></cit> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (inst. of <hi rend="ital">gen. of gerund.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">avidi committere pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscere amantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:472" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaos innumeros avidum confundere mundos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:696 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 696 al.</bibl></cit>—A. more remote gen. relation is found in Lucr.: <cit><quote lang="la">Humanum genus est avidum nimis auricularum,</quote> <trans><tr>in respect of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 594</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4711.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avida in novas res ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidae in direptiones manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n4711.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum manus subitis avidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4711.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> and transf. to inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt avidae (aures meae), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidi cursus frena retentat equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidae libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4711.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp </sense><sense id="n4711.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Eager for</hi> gain, <hi rend="ital">avaricious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covetous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy of money</hi>, = avarus: <cit><quote lang="la">me dices avidum esse hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 43</bibl>:  <cit><quote lang="la">Sed habet patrem quendam avidum, miserum atque aridum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut, 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiasque Conduplicant avidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum ad rem avidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grati animi, non appetentis, non avidi signa proferri perutile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidae manus heredis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 19 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4711.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Eager for</hi> food, <hi rend="ital">hungry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voracious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttonous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Avidos vicinum funus et aegros Exanimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 75</bibl></cit>: Noli avidus esse in omni epulatione, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:37:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 37, 32</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Efficit ut largis avidum mare fluminis undis,</quote> <trans><tr>insatiable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1031</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Exitio est avidum mare nautis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus Mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 234</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:724" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 724</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n4711.9" n="C" level="2"> In Lucr. of space as swallowing up objects, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inde avidei partem montes silvaeque ferarum Possedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 202</bibl></cit>: avido complexu quem tenet aether <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1066" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1066</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 470</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedily</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n4711.10" n="a" level="4"> Anteclass. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭdĭter</orth>: invadere pocula, Val. Antias ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 155</bibl>; so App.: merum ventri ingurgitare, Met. 4, p. 145, 27.— </sense><sense id="n4711.11" n="b" level="4"> Class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăvĭdē</orth>: ab ludis animus atque aures avent avide exspectantes mentium, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 83</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 71 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adripere Graecas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpetere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 40</bibl></cit>;
